Now it's $9.99/mo per phone line AND per extension. Want 1 phone line and 4 extensions? That'll be $50/mo for 1 phone line. That is NOT affordable anymore considering the very limited features offered.-While I could afford that $50/mo if I wanted to, I don't want to because the system simply doesn't work. My auto-attendant stops answering calls after roughly 20 hours. I have to unplug and reset the device to have it work again.-I've called support and opened multiple tickets regarding the above issue. I was assured a call-back and follow-ups and have received none despite my persistence. So I have a no-longer-affordable phone system with limited features that simply doesn't work.-There is no way to call out on your mobile phone. This was never advertised to be part of the system, but it's a HUGE glaring flaw. Almost every other service from RingCentral, Nextiva, Microsoft Lync, etc allows you to call out from your mobile using your business phone number. Anytime I get a call on my mobile (forwarded from Ooma) that I would have to call back, I have to call it from my cell #.-There is no support for 800 numbers-There is no integration with any other service, like Outlook.-Call quality (at least for me) is poor. It pops a lot and people tell me they have a hard time hearing me. I have 15/mb download and 3mb upload internet. I'm the only user. It's not that the internet speed is being taxed, it's got plenty of bandwidth for 1 phone line.I could go on, but I think I've made my point. The system costs nearly as much as the competition now but offers 1/3 or 1/4 of the features. Even with only 1/4 of the features, the glaring issue is that they don't work! On top of that, there is literally no support.At this point I will not be recommending the system or selling the system to my small business clients. Steer clear and invest in something better.-----------------------------UPDATE 2/7/14-------------------------------------------Roy Calvo, the Ooma Director of Customer Operations, made a personal phone call to me the day after my initial review went live on Amazon. He was very concerned with my impression of Ooma and wanted to provide some updates and also gather more feedback from me.First, the major issue I'd had with Ooma from the start was with the Virtual Receptionist not answering calls. I reached out to Ooma numerous times regarding the issue and never heard back. For this, Roy apologized and took full responsibility. He said my tickets had been updated numerous times by higher tiered support but that nobody took the time to reach out and notify me that they were working on the issue. Roy said that they would be reviewing my Amazon Review in Monday's management meeting and implementing changes to assure customers weren't left in the dark. Resolution Pending.Second, my other major complaint was the "Bait and Switch" Ooma pulled with their pricing structure for those that purchased the system under their old model. Roy told me that they had a policy in place to honor the old pricing structure for those that signed up under the old model. I had, however, called support and complained about the new model over a month ago and was told that there was nothing they could do. I asked to speak to a manager and was told that one would call me back and they never did. Roy said he was extremely disappointed to hear this and that he would find out why the customer support representatives were unaware that customers were to be given the old pricing model if they signed up with Ooma Office at that time. He asked me to add the extensions (which were Free under the old model) that I wanted and that the billing would be taken care of on their end. Roy explained the reasoning beyond the change in pricing (Both easier to explain and cheaper for MOST businesses). Problem Solved.Third, Roy said they are re/building the mobile application from the ground up. They want to re-do their app for the residential sector first then modify it for the business sector clients. They brought their developers in-house and are making strides for a smoother, better, experience on the app. One of my complaints here was that this was a feature promised to come shortly after launch. Six months later, on the phone with technical support, I asked about the progress of this app. The technician indicated he knew nothing of it and to "follow the blog for regular updates." This worried me, as I assumed a support tech should have some knowledge of ongoing projects and maybe even timelines. Roy said he was surprised by this as well and would ensure that techs, especially at higher levels, were more regularly informed of updates at the develop. Resolution pending.Last: 800 Numbers are coming down the road. No plans to integrate with Outlook are in the pipes. Neither are there plans for Business SMS messages.I've raised my review from 1 to 3 stars. I'll wait to see if there is a resolution to the Virtual Receptionist issue and the Mobile App before deciding once and for all what I will tell others about Ooma. For now, I will still not be selling the system to my small business customers. It has potential but also glaring kinks and service issues that need to be addressed. I am EXTREMELY impressed by the customer service that was exhibited over the last 48 hours from a senior member of their management team. As Roy pointed out, Ooma is a small company (in the big scheme of things) and relies on word of mouth. I'm a firm believer in word-of-mouth as I rely heavily on it myself. I'll see if Ooma can resolve issues and maintain open and regular communication in the long-run before deciding to put my business reputation on the line by selling the system to others.---------------------UPDATE 6/30/14-----------------------------I never heard back from Roy or Ooma about the auto attendant issue I had been experiencing. My business has been growing and I find myself needing to make mobile calls more and more. I went looking for a phone service that offered me a mobile app that I could use to place calls while on the go. I have not used Ooma office in almost 4 months now. I am still paying them their monthly fee because I haven't finished transferring some of my Auto-Attendant recording from their service yet. So I really need to get on that.Anyway, there's no progress posted on their Blog about a mobile app. There's really no new features at all that I can see in the past 4 months. I haven't heard from support. It's about time to call it a day on this service.Doug BuchanBuchan Consulting LLC

I've had this case for about 6mo now. I bought it for my first DSLR (Canon SL1). I don't have others to compare it to but I can tell you that it seems like it's a great travel pack.How I use it:I only have 1 lens for the camera, which I leave attached. The camera with the 18-55 lens fits nicely into the case without the need to detach it.The camera fits easily, with room to spare, int he inner protective liner. I do like to use the inner liner with the camera's shoulder strap as a portable bag. Very handy. The full size outer case is a bit large for comfortable carry to the inner protective sleeve is great.The case has plenty of room for little accessories and I imagine the sides would easily fit two medium sized lenses.I wasn't sure this would be worth the money. It might still be a bit overpriced, but it's solid. The zippers are quality, the bottom is rubber (no moisture seepage), and the material is thick. Get what you pay for.Doug Buchan[...]

So our dishwasher was making a loud grinding noise and it had been getting louder over a few week period of time. I usually pay no mind to the dishwasher and assume they need little to no maintenance. I failed.To try to get the dishwasher to run quieter I began to dis-assemble it. I found that the drain unit at the bottom was caked in dried dishwasher detergent. I had no idea that the powder dishwasher detergent could do that? After talking to the dishwasher repair folks at our local appliance store we found out that the powder dish soaps that most people use are the #1 cause of dishwasher failure.We've since switched to the Finish brand packets. These were recommended.In addition, the Dishwasher Magic cleaners were recommended. What a difference on the inside of the machine! The machine smelled great, ran quieter, and cleaned cleaner. There is no way one of these bottles would get rid of all the caked on soap (the required manual labor) but it did get rid of residue, stains, and caked on food.The suggestion was to run one of these per month. We haven't kept to that regimen, but we try to get one in every time we think of it.Truly and amazing and useful product.Doug Buchan[...]

I bought this as a replacement for one of my client's laptops. Usually these aftermarket chargers are cheap knock-offs that barely pass as a functional item.This item is OEM quality and fit nicely in the laptop. It's the best after-market charger I've seen so far. Really a nice surprise.Doug Buchan[...]

I've been adding to my DeWalt 20V MAX line of tools over the past year, and sometime this summer, I added this to my lineup and I love it!This tool is merely 5.5" long and fits in tight spaces.It's brushless and runs forever!It's got 3 speeds so it won't tear up your delicate materials. Or it can tear right through the screws driving them as fast as anything I've seen.It's lightweight and well balanced.I've added a belt clip and it's light enough that it hangs on the belt with ease.The lights on it are bright and really do a great job of lighting the work area. They're not just a gimmick.Cons:There's no way to turn off the impact function, so it self-triggers, sometimes when it's not needed.The recessed chuck is nice 95% of the time. One time I added one of those short 1/2" philips head bits to try to fight the thing into a small space. Well, the bit didn't have enough weight to fall out on it's own. I had to pull it (easily done) with pliers. But how often would anyone really use a 1/2" bit in this drill? More likely we'll all be using the 1" or longer bits.Overall, this tool is outstanding and it's now my favorite when it comes to driving and fastening. It doesn't replace a hammer drill but it's certainly a good replacement for a plan old screwdriver. I love it!I'll be using this on all my server builds, home improvement projects, TV mountings for clients, etc. Gonna really come in handy!Doug Buchan[...]

I've been picking up all of my 20V MAX DeWalt tools over the past year and trying them all out. This past summer (2013) I picked up the DEWALT DCD985L2 20-Volt MAX Li-Ion Premium 3.0 Ah Hammerdrill/Driver Kit and have been using it since. Then I grabbed the DCF985 brushless impact driver and I love it. So when I saw DeWalt was releasing the DCD995 brushless hammer drill I had to snag it.So here's the deal with this. It's smaller than the DCD985 hammer drill which is OK by me. The 985 was a bit bulky and hard to fit in tight spaces. This guy isn't a whole lot better, but I think they managed to shave roughly an inch off by adding an electronic clutch. The tool is 7.9" long. Not bad!In addition to being brushless, which in itself adds 58% to the battery life, the DCD995M2 only comes with 4.0ah batteries; no more 3.0ah batteries. That's a good thing as it provides far more run time (technically an hour, but seems like more). So between the brushless motor and the 4.0 ah batteries, of which there are 2 in this kit, this drill runs forever! This drill, like the 985, has a 3 speed switch which allows you to adjust speed to what you're doing. Drilling vs fastening etc are better suited to specific speeds. The switch works well and feels nice.I don't like, however, that they removed the 3 position (Drill, Fasten, Hammer) selector ring that was on the 985. Now those 3 modes are part of the torque selector ring. It's not the end of the world, but it was nice to have the mode selection separate from the torque ring.Overall, it's a solid tool, runs forever, and is an awesome addition to the DeWalt 20V MAX brushless line of XR tools.I'll be using this on all of my home theater and networking installs.Doug Buchan[...]

I like the new Logitech 915-000194 Harmony Smart Control with Smartphone App and Simple Remote - Black system. I have 3 of them now and 1 works correctly, two don't. See that review for more details.Each one of those kits comes with one of these IR blasters in the kit. I purchased this item in addition because one of the IR blasters that came with my SmartHub stopped working (again, another issue to see in my other review). So let's review this actual item:Pros- It works with the Logitech hubs.- It's small enoughCons- It's not extremely powerful. I had this about 12" behind my TV and it wasn't enough to turn the TV on and off. Seems like 12" regardless of the angle should have been OK.- The cord is short. I think about 6'. That's fine in many cases but in this case I ran the cord behind the wall up to the wall-mounted TV. The cord was not long enough to go all the way up. Had to buy an extension cord for it.- 1 of these (that came in the Logitech 915-000194 Harmony Smart Control with Smartphone App and Simple Remote - Black kit), did stop functioning.Overall, if you need one, then buy it. It'll probably meet your needs. If you're between this and another product that might work as well or better, I might suggest you buy the other product.Doug Buchan[...]

I own an Epson WorkForce Pro WP-4540 All-in-One Printer and purchased these as replacement cartridges. They don't fit and they don't work. Nothing else to be said.Ran to OfficeMax for the real deal. Unfortunately seems like ink might be better off being OEM. Always the most annoying part about a printer.Doug Buchan[...]

I think the lengthy review that was left by another customer (the top rated review) of this product is spot on.Summary of my experience with the product:Pros-The case is thick, makes me think it would protect my HTC ONE very well- It leaves the speakers open (also a con)Cons-The plastic under the rubber covering already cracked on the side. This happened when removing the phone from the case, not after a fall or any kind of trauma to the case.-The speakers are left open-Adds bulk to the phone-The headset port is bulked up by the case, making any credit card reader or other device that fits flush on the phone un-usable. Only round headphone jacks will fit in, anything else would require the case be taken off-The screen gets nasty under the screen protector because the speakers are open, so dirt and grud can slip in under the protector.Overall, I'm not impressed for the price.Doug Buchan[...]

I don't think it's fair to review a product based on expectations beyond the product's scope, so I'll try to stick to what the product is supposed to do: be a starter kit for the DEWALT DCS355D1 20V XR Lithium-Ion Oscillating Multi-Tool Kit which I think is the best thing since sliced bread.So this kit is supposed to be a starter kit and offer 5 essential blades to get you started. The good news, in the nutshell, is that the blades are great starter blades.The con: The kit that they come in doesn't even fit the one semi-circular blade that comes with the kit.So the blades are good, the case doesn't fit any of the larger blades, including the "wide" woodcut blades sold seprately.Still not a bad kit, but it's pretty dumb that it doesn't fit all of the blades sold for the tool, let alone all the blades in the kit.Doug Buchan[...]

I'm a huge fan of the new DeWalt 20V tools. I've been converting my old 18V volt line one tool at a time (basically as fast as I can sell them off). This DeWalt DCS380M1 tools replaces my old DEWALT DC385K 18-Volt Ni-Cad Cordless Reciprocating Saw Kit.So there's very little difference between the tools. If you've owned the 18V version, this is going to function just about the same but it'll work harder for longer.The tools great features:- 20V battery, newer 4.0ah battery with fuel gauge- Well balanced and powerful- Continues to run, just slower, when battery gets low- 4 position chuck allows 4 different cutting anglesNegatives:- Only comes with 1 battery. Common DeWalt, we're paying enough, give us another batteryThis is still truly a worthwhile tool. A good reciprocating saw is absolutely invaluable for the DIY, handyman and any construction contractor.Just a side note, since purchasing this tool I've also acquired DEWALT DCS355D1 20V XR Lithium-Ion Oscillating Multi-Tool Kit and I love the tool. It might actually be a suitable replacement for a reciprocating saw for SMALL jobs. It would never replace it for agressive sawing needs.--UPDATE 1/9/14--This DOES have an adjustable depth. Use the yellow button on the side to adjust cut depth. Very cool!Doug Buchan[...]

I'm lucky, I'm in my 20's and as I go about purchasing all of my powertools for the first time, I'm able to invest heavily in the DeWalt 20V MAX line of tools. I own most of the useful ones including reciprocating saw, brushless hammer drill, brushless impact driver, and a few others including their poor excuse for a radio haha.I went to do some work on my car a few weeks ago and bought the 20V MAX grinder / cutoff tool. As I went online to research the tool some more I found out about the 20V MAX Oscillating Multi-Tool. I'd never used one before so I viewed a number of YouTube videos and did my research. It sure as heck sounded like it'd be worth the money. It sure beats buying a sander, metal saw, drywall saw, caulk putty knife, and a jigsaw.So I've but this bad boy to work over the past 2 weeks and it ROCKS!Projects list:- I own the DeWalt drywall jab knife and reciprocating saw. I've used both in the past for drywall repair and not knowing any better, they have done just fine. Well, I just used the DeWalt 20V MAX Oscillating tool to do two drywall cutouts and it's amazing. The easiest and cleanest cut I've had yet with smooth edges!- After drywalling of course I had to sand. I've used a hand sander in the past and it works just fine. But I've really had to sand pretty hard over some areas where I used too much putty on the walls. So I decided to give the 20V MAX tool a try. What a breeze to sand! And it doesn't take off too much either, you have excellent control based on the variable speed trigger and how much pressure you put on the tool.- While I was working in a client's house installing their TV, they saw me sanding their wall with the 20V MAX Multi-tool. My client, a 50ish year old woman, liked the tool and commented on it. Being thrilled with the tool myself I started to tell her about it and all it could do. She brought me to a corner of her living room where the molding had been poorly caulked. She said it'd been bothering her for years. So I handed her the tool, showed her how to attach the putty blade, and let her remove the caulk. It came right off first time, with ease, with a 50 year old woman using it for the first time. How's that for user friendly and effective? This tool is easy to control!I haven't used this yet on hard wood or nails, but I can't imagine it will disappoint.Another note: I'm still on the first charge on the battery. I've been using the tool for 2 weeks and have not charged it after the first charge.My only complaint... I'm a slave to the DeWalt hard Kit Boxes. I like my tools all protected. I wish this had a kit box and not a contractor bag.All in all, this will be my most useful and handy tool to have around. Truly worth the money!-----UPDATE 12/29/13-----------So I went to add the DeWalt belt hook to this model (DeWalt Hammerdrill Driver DCD980L2 DCD985L2 because all of the DeWalt 20V MAX line have the hook slots on the handles. This oscillating tool would be the perfect size and weight for hanging on the belt. Anyway, this tool does not have the nut built into the handle to attach the screw holding on the hook. The hole is there, just not nut in it. I guess I have to go search for one. Not worth deducting a star, but it truly is "the little things" that can be annoying.Doug Buchan[...]

Great little locks for decorative or light duty purposes. Seem to work as needed. I wouldn't trust them to lock anything that really needs to be safe. But otherwise they're great.

I think this was one of the best horror films I've seen. Everything in the movie is logical. What do I mean? Well, if you knew 8 of your friends had just died by walking out of the house, would you follow them? Probably not. But that's how most horror movies go: You find yourself yelling at the screen "NO! Don't do that!" Well, this movie is different. Everything that happens has a logical explanation. I found myself saying "Well, that sucks, but I probably would've done the same thing... there was no choice." So that makes the movie that much scarier, because you can see it happening to you! I like it!

Excellent quality unit. We've used a few of these in our racks for ods and ends like cable modems and wifi routers. Very sturdy and the venting is useful for zip tying items on to the rack.Doug Buchan[...]
These fit (my girlfriend) pretty well. She's 5'8" so she's pretty tall. These had to be stretched to the max to get on. But once they were on she really liked them and they seem to have held up well.

Quality set of DeWalt tools that feel like they're going to hold up well.Most all of my tools are DeWalt branded and I like consistency. If you didn't already know, Stanley tools is the same as DeWalt now but cheaper. Almost every tool in the DeWalt lineup has an identical twin in the Stanley lineup but Stanley is less expensive. If you're not a slave to the brand, buy the cheaper Stanley tool.Additionally, I usually buy on Amazon due to convenience, no tax, and force of habit. The tools, however, are sometimes cheaper at your local Big Box store. My local Home Depot had these hand tools for significantly less. Check local first in these cases.Doug BuchanBuchanConsulting.com

Solid belt hook that seems like it will really hold tight! Only problems I see is that it only fits on one side of the tool (not ambidextrous) and also prevents some DeWalt cases from closing.My DeWalt 12V MAX inspection scope has a mounting point for this hook, but the case won't close with the hook installed.Pretty dumb!Doug BuchanBuchanConsulting.com

Extremely tall and extremely sexy. Fit my girlfriend true to size. She was up and walking on these sky high heels in a matter of minutes and proficient in a matter of days.She says they're comfortable and sexy as well. So no complaints as of yet!

This is a great add-on but should have been included with the original tools.  I shouldn't have to pay extra after spending so much on a tool to begin with.My main complaint is that it can only go on one side of the tool. You can't mount 2 of these to hold 2 bits. 1 bit holder per tool.Doug BuchanBuchanConsulting.com

Used it for one outlet so far, and it seems solid. Certainly a smidge of wiggle in the blade but it is truly minuscule and has no effect on operation at all. This thing is flippin massive. No doubt about that! If that's what you're looking for, a 10" long pop can, then have at it.We got this for her to practice oral. Well, maybe if she un-hinges her jaw it'll work!But more importantly, regardless of your intended use (unless planning on using it as a self-defense weapon) my major concern is the smell/taste. This is a pungent rubber smell and taste. It's cheap rubber, you can tell. Not silicone or latex for sure. You have to wonder what chemicals this Chinese rubber has in it and what get released as you use it "in" you. I'd buy a safer rubber like silicone or latex if I were you. It costs more at first, but it's cheaper than vaginal cancer (or whatever you might get from wacky chemicals in you).Like I said, not all hope is lost, you can use this as a weapon.

I have preferred Seagate to WD drives for a number of years. Originally my logic was due to the warranty being longer. It seems all has equaled out between the two competitors, but out of habit I still stick with Seagate for my hard drive needs. In the 10 years I've been using the brand, I have yet to have a drive fail on me. I realize this is attributable to luck in many ways, but regardless, the brand and this specific drive have performed flawlessly.

I wear these socks with my work shoes in the Emergency Room. Not that these socks can't be worn in any other circumstance, I just like to keep my "wear 12 hours a day at work" socks separate from my others. Anyway, I buy a 6-pack of these usually once every 9-12 months and they hold up great! I don't have to replace them because of wear and tear, rather my feet just make 'em stink after 9 months of shift work!So I keep going back to these because they're inexpensive, well made, and hold up great under constant work on my feet. They're thick and comfortable.

This is a simple mod for the Tippmann X7 Phenom marker. It takes the MP5 style mag and replaces it with an M4/M16 style mag. The mag itself still has tool storage in it for your allen wrench/hex keys. So the functionality is the same, the look is different, the quality is good, what more do you need?

I got this tank holder to put on my MOLLE Brokos Belt from 5.11 Tacitcal. I mounted the tank horizontally on my back. It was a perfect fit for my large Ninja tank and it fit the webbing perfectly.I didn't like the way it bounced on my back (not the product's fault) while I was playing, so I moved this tank to the vertical position and mounted it on my MOLLE plate carrier vest. It's perfect there.This tank pouch has versatile straps, secures the tank, mounts vertical or horizontal with the straps, and is an excellent value.I recommend.

I have a 2003 CR-V that had only one headlight lens that was foggy. So I'd been putting off doing a restoration because it wasn't a complete necessity.I decided to go ahead and purchase this kit when I had some downtime one week and completed the restoration after it arrived from Amazon.The kit was easy to open. The instructions were lengthy and somewhat tedious but detailed. Because this process must be completed exactly in the order prescribed, it's important to read the lengthy directions.I had everything set up in a matter of 10 minutes, getting the drill, papertowels, and my DeWalt radio to listen to some music while I worked.I followed all of the steps, repeated some to try to get the cleanest finish on the lens, and wiped everything clean. The lens looks 95% better.The ONLY complaint I have is that there are certainly still hairline scratches on the lens from the sand paper. This is 100% un-noticeable at any distance over a 3' from the car. The lens looks perfect from any distance > 3'. Close examination shows the scratches. This may have been user error but I re-sanded using the finest grain paper and the buffer pad numerous times and still was left with very light, faint, almost invisible scratches.The lens looks good as new. We'll see how long it stays that way. The kit recommends almost $100 in additional 3M products to protect the lenses long term as well as other lens cleaning kits and more. Hopefully I don't need any of it. It lasted 10 years when it was new, I hope for another 3 or 4 now.Doug[...]

I bought this before a 5 day camping trip. I planned to use it to charge my Android smartphone each night of the 5 day trip. I figured if the battery unit weighed 5x what my phone weighs it must be able to charge the obviously smaller battery in my phone!Well, it gave it a full charge 2 nights in a row. Day 3 I have to charge the pack and my phone in the car.My only question is whether or not this pack stop charging when the phone is full. If not, I could understand why charging overnight is a bad idea. You may need to be there to turn off the pack when the phone is charged or maybe it wastes the battery pack's battery?Doug B.Buchan Consulting LLC[...]

Mounts into the 2002 Dodge Stratus and fits the aftermarket radio and the dashboard flawlessly. It's secure, looks perfect, is affordable, and quality. No complaints at all with this.Doug B.Buchan Consulting LLC[...]

I bought this when I needed to install an aftermarket stereo in my 2002 Dodge Stratus. I wasn't sure if I would need it, but I did. The adapter plugs in fine and the radio reception is still excellent. I have no complaints at all. Easy, simple, and affordable.Doug B.Buchan Consulting LLC[...]

I bought this when I needed to install an aftermarket stereo in my 2002 Dodge Stratus. I wasn't sure if I would need it, but I did. The adapter plugs in fine and the radio reception is still excellent. I have no complaints at all. Easy, simple, and affordable.Doug B.Buchan Consulting LLC[...]

I can't bring myself to get too excited about a Peeler, no matter how well it works.  I have to admit, however, that these seem to be of surprisingly good quality for the money.  They work well.  And they are VERY sharp, so watch your fingers--I've found that they work just as well on them.

On the whole, I did enjoy this book.  I found the entire idea of a race of beings who assist Soulmates to find each other to be rather intriguing.  The characters are interesting, but not overly developed as yet.  So far, it is YA Appropriate.There are wrong word errors that need further proofreading.  The concepts, although showing potential, are vague--I needed a lot more background that I didn't receive in this first book.  There are times that I almost felt that I'd missed a prior book.Nice writing style, and unique ideas.  It was a decent read for me, and I'm tempted to get Book Two to see where the series goes from here.

I've been a fan of the world of Pern for many years.  The Dragons are original and unique in Fantasy.  Although this book had some issues, it did transport me back into the series and characters in spite of the years since I've read the series.A few too many subplots for my taste, and a little too much detail now and then.  But I did like the new development concerning the Dragon's abilities.  I'm hoping that the series will continue with more surprises.

I left off some years ago, when Todd McGaffrey stepped in.  Just recently, however,  I downloaded "The Skies of Pern"--which is one that I apparently missed by Anne McCaffrey herself.  You'd think that after a number of years that it would take some effort to reacquaint yourself with the characters and storyline.  Not so!  I was amazed at how quickly I got back into the World of Pern and its wonderful Dragons.In fact, reading "Skies" has rekindled my nostalgia enough that I believe that I'll check out the ones by Todd McCaffrey that I haven't read.  If you enjoy books that are long enough to satisfy, a writing style that is exceptionally good, and fantastic World Building and characters (not the least of whom are Dragons!)--then this is a series that will be worth your while.Although the books do not end in cliffhangers (imagine that, some authors don't use that marketing gimmick), it is best to read the books in order so that you're familiar with both the characters and the plotline.  YA appropriate, as the sexual situations aren't explicit.

I was impressed enough with the first two books to take advantage of the Prime Kindle Lending Library to borrow the third.  The plot is involved, the Supernatural World is abundant in its various species, and the characters are becoming like old friends.There were some wrong word proofreading errors.  There was still some changing POV's that I don't like--some chapters are simply the same pivotal scene from a different character's point of view.  I find that a waste of book space, myself.  But even so, the action is great, and I really enjoy the characters.Although this isn't a cliffhanger, it does leave off the story in a suspenseful way.  I can't wait to read the final installment in order to see how this all plays out.

Because the posts will bend easily; and since the backings are so tiny, it's easy to bend the posts trying to connect the backs to the posts.  So be aware that you're not getting any more gold than necessary.The largest size is a good size for the main ear piercing.  I find those largest ones too large for a second piercing hole.  The crystals are quite sparkly, but for some reason something about their appearance reminds me of rhinestones--especially the largest ones.That being said, I still think that they're OK.  But I could have wished for thicker posts, larger backings, and smaller crystals.

I strongly suggest reading Book 1 before this book, or you'll be totally lost.  It's been a while since I read the first, but it didn't take long to get back into the world, plot, and fantastic characters.  The books are well written and engaging.I am not a fan of the changing POV's that simply repeat chapter after chapter of the same scenes from a different character's perspective.  To me, it's a waste of pages that could be better utilized moving the plot along.  But that is not enough to turn me away from the series--because it's good enough to overcome this irritation.I will be going on to the third book.

Due to the size of these opals, and the width of the sterling silver design that surrounds these earrings, they have some substantial weight.  Because of this, they are heavy and tend to tilt forward on my earlobe.  I had to substitute some large plastic backings in lieu of the standard ones supplied in order for them to rest flat on my ear.I would have preferred less sterling and larger diamonds (they are quite tiny).  However, the simulated Opals are quite pretty.  So, I find them to be Ok, but not my favorites.

But it was still a fast and fun read.  I like mythology, so I know Triton as a son of Poseidon;  but he was the calmer of the seas, not the god who watched over sailors--that was Paleamon.  But I still enjoyed this book as an entertaining Paranormal Romance.This is an adult read, not for the young reader.  The sex (especially in the second half of the book) is explicit.  I liked that the characters grew and developed, and that the other Gods played substantial parts in the story.  Although not extremely long, at least this can't be called a novella.  And best of all, it has an ending--not a cliffhanger.For me, 3-1/2 stars.  I'd be agreeable to reading more in the series.

Because I'm curious to find out what else lives in the World of this book, I'll probably go on to Book Two to find out.  This first book took a while to get me involved.  It started out a little slow, but did give some background on the main character and her "previous"  life.  It does need some proofreading and editing, but at least this was a decent length compared to most of the Paranormal books that I've read lately.I did find it a little on the darker side than I prefer, but it ended reasonably well.  It did leave some unanswered issues,  which is why I'm curious enough to continue with the series.  It seems to have potential.

This costume will make you appear slimmer than you actually are...which is great, considering that you're dressing up as a skeleton.  I am 5'-8" and 137#.  I was conflicted as to ordering the medium or the large.  I finally went with the large, because I was concerned that the medium might not be long enough in the leg and arm lengths.(NOTE:  I ordered and received a Large, but for some reason it shows on this review as a Medium)This suit has enough length in both the arms and legs for me.  It has enough Spandex to be form-fitting without being too revealing in the crotch and rear areas.  It is slimming and comfortable.  I've purchased some gloves with the bone shape, and will apply some temporary face tattoos to complete the look.I dock one star in the rating because it only has the bones in the front.  I also wish that the neckline was higher so that the pattern would show up to the jawline--as it is, I'll have to use body paint to keep all my skin from showing.  But I'm very happy with this purchase and am anxious to wear it.

It was time--it was old, and terribly discolored.  In fact, I think it was older than I am, since my mother passed it along to me.This is a good kitchen necessity.  I like that it has the option of a flat side and a nubby side.  I like the weight, and the handle provides a good grip.  And best of all, it's SO shiny compared to my old aluminum mallet.  I wish that the nubs were just a tad bigger,  but I can live with it.  I'm a  little disappointed that it is seamed where the flat and nubby sides meet the main head, as I worry about food hiding in the seam.  However, it being dishwasher safe alleviates that concern to some extent.I'm happy with it.  In fact, I may buy another one as a gift so that I don't have to "pass it along"......

This first Book in the series had a good plot premise, with nice romance and some decent action scenes.  I was intrigued enough to read to the end, which was resolved enough to not leave a reader hanging.  There is obviously more to the story, though.The writing is a little young for even the target audience in regard to dialogue.  It seemed more tween than college.  The writing needs polish and editing.  Overall, though, it was an OK read for me.  I'm not sure if I'm hooked enough to read the next book, but this one was moderately entertaining.

In spite of this, I'll admit that I did enjoy it.  There are some problems with sentence structure and wrong word errors.  And it does read more like a YA than it should, considering some sexual scenes.  But it has potential, since the action scenes are good and the World is interesting.I believe that this author's other series on Dragons should be read before this one.  I did read the first of that series, but did not continue it due to the short lengths of the books.  I may reconsider, since even though I read the first one of that series, I was still pretty lost while reading this book until I figured out who the Heroine's  parents were.

Which is my mistake--never hit that "Buy Now With 1-Click" button without double checking.I've read many of the J.D. Robb Dallas books and really enjoyed them.  I've only read a couple of her others.  So maybe this is written in her style, I can't be sure.  But this was only an OK read for me--nothing special.The Hero was just not that appealing.  He should have gotten himself out of his tricky situation in some manner, considering his background.  The Heroine was a little shallow, constantly feeling insecure even though she was wealthy and pretty.It just read more like a long Harlequin romance to me, and I quit reading them when I was young because they were basically all alike.  But it was a decent read and written well, so I don't consider it a waste of time.  If you read HEA romance books, you'll probably enjoy it.

I'm not really into pearls, but when wearing a dressy white top,  I wanted something that would look elegant.  Two comments made me hesitate:1.  Somebody said that they were forward heavy (so I thought that they'd be too large or saggy)2.  Several made statements that the backings were either small or insufficient for the earrings--in fact, a couple people said that they had lost or almost lost them due to this issue.I did not find either problem with the earrings that I received.  Although a tad larger than I would have preferred, they still sit flush against my ear, and there is still room for tiny diamond studs in my second piercing.  The posts are quite long, which surprised me.  The backs are also larger than normal, giving sufficient stability.  I was prepared to replace the backs with some large circle plastic backs, but I don't have to do so.The pearls are lovely and larger than I expected.  The diamonds are very small, but I could see that they would be from the illustration.  The raised sides are quite detailed and well created, giving the earrings beauty from all angles.In conclusion, they are exactly as advertised and I am quite pleased with the purchase.

And this one didn't leave a reader hanging quite as much as the first book.  I still wish for a little more background on this world.  And the writing could be a little more polished, especially the dialogue.  Sometimes it's hard to determine who is speaking, and the conversations and actions seem a bit YA to me--but the sex scenes are adult.I selected this as my monthly Prime Kindle Lending Library selection because the first book was interesting.  I liked this one as well.  The characters are familiar, and this book had a couple of unexpected surprises to add to the storyline.  I will likely continue the series.

Very little peppermint--either that or it's simply overwhelmed by the terrible soapy taste.  I actually have to fight not to gag, especially when I brush it over my tongue.  It does seem to leave my teeth feeling clean, but then again, so does toothpaste.  I've not found it to be any more beneficial for gum health than regular toothpaste, either.Note that this is supposed to be a 3-month supply (one uses very little).  When I purchased this on August 9th,  it was being supplied through a company  by the name of Pure Essense Health.  They sent me a bottle that said "Best before October".  There's still more than half the bottle left and I'll be throwing it out now.  Hmmm...Since I really hate the taste of this stuff, I won't miss it.  I'm just sorry that I wasted my money and then had to throw it out besides.

Good romance and well drawn characters.  Great plot and action.  I could have wished for a longer book with better initial world building, since this is Book One of a series.  But I found it to be a lively and easy read.Sometimes it wasn't clear who was speaking--a little better editing would fix that.  I did not find the ending satisfying, as it didn't resolve even one of the romances or any of the storyline.  I prefer to look forward to the next book in a series because I enjoy the writing, stories, and characters--NOT because I've been left hanging.  But in spite of this, I liked it.

Especially if they like a fireside yarn.  It has some psychological musings, some hard luck, some 'devil made me do it', and some sexual liaisons.  It has a decent writing style, and really interesting characters.For me, it was just OK--but then, I'm not musically inclined.  I found the descriptions and details a little overwhelming at times, and I generally had to force myself to continue reading.  I did like the ending, but it sure was hard to get there, sorry.

This is a great mattress.  It's a cinch to set up and it's surprisingly comfortable.  Just make sure you are prepared when opening it:  Think SPROING!Also, it needs a room with good airflow when you open it and air it out for the first 24hrs.

This is quite the impressive radar / laser detection device.  It's fire & forget easy for people like me, but it has all sorts of extra features and advanced functions for the more advanced user.The internal operating system and hardware are time proven and well respected.  Add to that the drop in and go ease of operation and I'm extremely happy with this unit.

First things first:  This is listed as a ladies watch, but this is truly a unisex watch.  This is a substantial timepiece.  It's constructed of solid stainless steel, including the strap / band.In terms of face size, this 36mm face is on par with an 80's / 90's men's Rolex or Girard Perregaux.  In fact this dwarfs my 1971 men's Rolex and Omega watches.Still, it is a 21st century unisex; my wife has more than one watch this size and one more that is larger (38mm).The strap can be adjusted to fit anyone with a wrist up to 8" around.While it looks like a chronograph it actually uses those subdials to indicate the day, the date and there is even a 24hr second time zone.The movement (internals) is a Swiss made ISA that runs on a type 371 (sr920sw) battery.Overall, she's a good watch that will keep super accurate time that can resist water damage to well over 300 feet.
Moen has done it again!  I love this shower head:  It was easy to install, it is easy to switch between spray patterns and it looks great in our large custom shower.  Definitely recommended!

This mat is perfect!  I have always had trouble with other fitness mats because they were too thin, they didn't offer enough cushion or support and I would get pain in areas that experienced too much pressure.Those problems have been solved with this mat.  This new Gaiam Extra Thick Mat is well over half an inch thick and finally solves my problem.It's easy to use, it stores and transports easily, and it doesn't slip around when I use it.  This is my new favorite exercise mat.

My wife is so excited for this toaster.  She had commented for years about the solution to over and under cooked toast being a see through toaster.  Here it is... Finally!Follow up:  I have truly come to appreciate the superior technology used in this toaster.  Instead of those fragile spindly wires to heat the toast, this one has encapsulated heating coils / rods at the bottom of each side of the slot.  It works, because heat rises, and it is how this toaster can provide the unimpeded view while toasting.  Awesome!This is an awesome toaster.  The single extra long slot is genius.  Pick your favorite color and give it a try.  Highly recommended!
This is an awesome little jump drive.  It's super fast and do very tiny.  I appreciate that it is white, it makes it easier to find.

These are pretty great.  The look good and the are very comfortable to the touch.I only knocked off a star because they are thin and porous...  there isn't much shock absorption and liquids (even Spaghetti sauce) will run through to the table beneath.The are lovely though.  Very classy!

This unit is powerful enough for most everything that the typical DIY home owners are likely to take on.Just read the manual and it's a simple to use compressor that will do it all.  It will keep your tires at the proper air pressure and it will power your finishing nailer.I'm not suggesting that this will replace my Dewalt Pancake compressor (she's so quiet), but this awesome little unit can do all the same stuff.  Sure, it's louder, but then this unit also has about half of the footprint (that smaller footprint could be a big deal to some people).This is a good compressor for the money.

I appreciate what they're going for with this product.  It turns out that I actually use it at my desk.  It allows me to listen to the music on my phone, while also charging my phone, without having to put any wear on my phone's speakers.  It's unexpectedly useful and I like it alot.
