Summertime means grilling right? Well my husband in this household is the grill king. I make sure he has all the right tools for the job as well. We will call the Sauce pot and Basting Brush by A1PP the crown and the ceptor. I had originally purchased just a regular paint brush for him to use. For some reason it just wasn't what he wanted. There was a promotional offer on this product for an honest review. I love buying items and reviewing them. My husband has been my test guinea pig on many items. This one though I think has been his favorite so far. He saw the package and even if it isn't for him he opens it.. So much for surprises huh? Well he saw this and was ready to find whatever he could to put on the grill. He started pulling stuff out of the fridge for his "Sauce". Wow. I was frightened for a short moment. His excitement was so intense. He says it is the perfect size, the brush is perfect because it won't burn. He went out and bought some ribs and went to town. Then I decided for dinner one night I would grill some chicken and personally I was thoroughly enjoying the experience as well. Now I may not love it like the Grill King, but I can see his affection for the item.

So as a woman at a beautiful age of 37 and raising 3 kids I can get a bit tired. I am not quite at the age where I have to worry about menopause or other consequences of aging. But with life you have to be on top of things and sometimes that does not include your husband. I know I know a bit dramatic. I love my husband dearly and he still after almost 10 years finds me very attractive and lets me know every chance he gets. I think he is still sexy as well and wish I had the energy to keep up with his drive. I saw a promotional offer for Lovera supplement and at first thought maybe i didn't need it because of my age. When I read some of the claims about increased libido and energy however I took the offer. I have barely been taking it for 2 weeks. I must say that within the first week I noticed a difference. My sex drive definitely increased. My husband I think noticed the difference before I did. He had a "What has gotten into you?!" moment. It was then I made the connection. My energy has increased as well. I felt more like getting projects done around the house instead of just maintaining.First I love how feminine the product looks. It comes in a cute little tub with a  snap top and a cute pink pouch. The product really caters to the woman in you. The one that likes to feel and look pretty. There is no aftertaste from the product and the pills are normal easy to swallow size. I recommend this product to any mom who is just tired and is looking for a natural supplement to help out.

I use these headphones ALL THE TIME! Earbuds hurt my ears and won't stay in. I have tried numerous kinds. The ones that do stay in hurt, or the ones that don't hurt won't stay. So I was looking for a comfortable set of headphones. I found these and loved them immediately. I will use them walking around the yard doing work. I use them to rehearse my music. I even use them to talk on my phone when I am busy doing dishes or need my hands free. I even fall asleep sometime with them on while listening to guided meditation. Yes they are that comfortable and amazing. If you are looking for a nice set of headphones and don't wan to spend A LOT of money. These are perfect.

I am an avid gardener and love growing culinary herbs and medicinal herbs. I usually use a mortal and pestle but that can be so time consuming. I have an herb grinder for my medicinal herbs but not really a separate one for my culinary herbs. There was an offer to get a discount on this item in exchange for a review and I was excited to receive it. I love trying new products that can better benefit my life and my kitchen skills. So my main grinding herbs are stevia, mint and rosemary. I pick them, dry them, and grind them. The stevia is such a beautiful plant and is what I used in the photos below. I use it in baking as a sweetner and I brew it in my tea.First let me describe the product. It is a four part grinder that has a magnetic top for grinding, large holes that catch the grinds on a screen and another bottom chamber that catches the small pollen or powdery bits. It has a small scraper to get all the powder bits for ultimate use.I for one love this as it is not to small and grinds the herbs perfectly. Not to small but not to big either, perfect for teas and spices. I have yet to use it on my medicinal herbs but I bet it would be great. Might even switch it out with my other one. Still out on that. Quick and easy to use. No fuss, no mess.. No more hand cramping mortal and pestle grinding. I have the WEnEED now.

I am thoroughly impressed with this eye cream. I have been using it for 2 weeks now. I saw a noticeable difference in the first week. The puffiness and dark circles under my eyes decreased dramatically. I have used creams and anti wrinkle serums before but not worked as well as this. There was no stinging or burning around my eyes. There is a little tightness but I would expect that if it is decreasing wrinkles and puffiness. There is no harsh chemical smells. It is my go to first thing in the morning and I even apply it before bedtime. Again I am impressed! Maybe even that isn't a good enough word but it is what I have. I can honestly claim though as a mom of three children my sleep habits are not at the finest. So to have something that actually does what it claims to do is a joyous occasion for me. It is part of my permanent face regimen.I received this product at a discount in exchange for my honest opinion. My opinion is. I love it! I will be buy it again and will be posting pics as soon as my computer will upload them from my camera. You have to see the difference to believe it. I have seen it and I believe it.

My husband is the coffee drinker of the house. I mean at least a pot a day. I on the other hand like to have one cup a day. I like the taste of coffee but usually only with cream and sugar. I shy away from drinking it because personally I could do without the extra calories the cream and sugar have to offer. Also I get the leftover coffee in the morning. The quarter pot that is sitting cold 2 hours after my husband has left for work. I usually add a cup of water, reusing the already used grounds,  and turn it on. Yes the coffee is a bit weak but I honestly don't want to brew another pot that will  be wasted. This also allows for my husband to still have a cup left when he gets home to have his iced coffee. Okay! I know that may seem like a lot just to review this coffee but it is leading to something very important to me. Something that has changed my enjoyment of coffee.We have locally roasted coffee companies in the area that we buy our coffee from. They have many spectacular blends, but not to many flavored blends. When offered a coupon to try this flavored organic coffee, there was no doubt I would enjoy choosing flavors. I have always been a fan of caramel and so of course I went for the Caramel Nut. There was temptation with other selections but I will save that for future purchases. I really like how it is already  ground, my husband prefers beans, hence why I get lazy about brewing more. This way I can still keep routine but one extra step of adding a tablespoon of Latitude Organic Caramel Nut coffee to the top of my husbands. I add my water and brew. (I would like to add that I also brewed this in my french press and tasted without the hubbies brew.)After it was done I wanted to taste it without my added calories. Immediately the aroma took my breath away. I know this sounds like someone who has never had caramel flavored coffee before, and I have, but it has been a LONG TIME. This was like starting all over again. THE AROMA!! No words in my vocabulary can describe that smell. I literally took a moment and pulled in long deep breathes through my nose. Even now my memory of it is enjoyable. Back to what I was saying. I took a sip of the coffee and I don't know coffee talk as far as robust, or nutty, or acidic. I say what I taste. I did notice the caramel flavor right away, partially I think cause my olfactory was still deeply connected to previous events. The flavor was light and yes I guess I would say nutty. All I know is the taste on my tongue was just as satisfied as my nose. I drank that entire cup without any extras. Then I did the french press and added a touch of cream. Oh my... Again words would be helpful, but all I have are emotions!! This is a welcomed part of my morning routine. I could almost cry. Overwhelmed with satisfaction and joy over my new morning cup of coffee. Literally changing how my days start. It tastes so absolutely amazing! I will be trying future flavored blends as well. This coffee is a must-have, and when brewed in a french press you really get a grand experience.

I have become a fitness enthusiast for the last few years. While I have not completely met my fitness goals I am steadily working to achieve them. So when I see particular supplements offered that can help me reach my goals I love to research them and then try them out. I saw a discounted offer for the L-Carnitine in exchange for a review and wanted to give it a try. First I did research the supplement itself to see if it would be something I could use. Of course I read that it increases blood flow and help with active muscle recovery after a workout. I knew that would be beneficial for me as I lift weights and rip my muscles apart. This leads to dealing with soreness the next day. It also stated that it will help improve cognitive ability as well. With 3 Kids I need all the cognitive help I can get. So I received the supplements approx. 2 weeks ago. I have been taking them consistently for 1 week. So far I have noticed a slight difference in my performance level during my workouts. My muscle soreness as decreased after my workouts. I have been making an effort to increase weights so I can truly test the product. Really pushing my muscles to their max.  As for my cognitive performance I am not so sure.As for the pills they are small and easy to swallow. The dosage is absolutely doable. Take 2 pills twice daily is easy to remember. I take them in the morning and afternoon. There are no side effects that I have noticed and no after taste. I have experienced some nasty after effects of other supplements. I was very glad that this one did not do that. So far I am enjoying the supplement and hope to report back with more definitive results.

We have this wonderful black cat that is amazing and we have never been able to get him to play with cat toys. He will LOVE playing with a brown paper bag. He loves hiding in boxes and reaching out to get you. I received a coupon code for this item and thought what the heck. When I got it in the mail I was really excited to try it. My kitty just happened to be outside and in a very relaxed mood. We took out the long toy with the fuzzy end and started moving it around .. He was immediately interested and loved playing with it. Unfortunately the mouse toy he was not so interested in. However we are constantly playing with him now and it is a lot more entertaining than a brown bag. My kids are enjoying the time with the kitty toy Just as much as he is.

I am no stranger to using menstrual cups. I have been using one for that last 5 years. I was ready to buy a new one when I saw this was up for a discount in return for a review.So the shape/design is like the other brand I have used which was really great because I did not want to try to get used to a new design. The cup itself comes in two different sizes, small for women who have not had children and large for those of us that have. The Large is not huge and is actually a comfortable size. The stem on the bottom really isn't that long with is also a plus because if they are to long they can be uncomfortable. The instructions were easy to follow. The cup itself is a very soft pliable material. Where the past one I used was a bit harder. So this has taken some getting used to. I am still unsure if I like that it is softer. I am getting used to the insertion process with it being a bit softer which is why I gave it 4 stars instead of five. This could change after a few uses and I find can really decide how I like it.It comes with a cute discreet bag to put it in when not in use.The seal is good and I have not experienced any leaks so far. My cycle is always heaviest the first 3 days so if it was going to leak it would have. Most of the time if you do experience leaking it is not inserted correctly. (I found this out the hard way).What I love most about using a menstrual cup is not only has it saved me HUNDREDS of dollars but it also helps protect the planet and our body from harmful heavy toxins and pollutants.I am super happy to see that this kind of product is on the market now. Knowing that these are on the market and having two daughters I am going to forgo the "mainstream" menstruating choices and introduce them to these instead.

I have never thought to use scissors for my herbs. I don't know why it has never crossed my mind, but it hasn't. I always just dry and crush, or chop them up on the cutting board with a knife. I really had no idea these existed until I saw the coupon for these in exchange for an honest review. Of course I was ready to try it out. I felt like I was getting to try out a new invention or something. When I received them in the mail I immediately ran to the herb garden. I told the kids and the husband: "I don't know whats for dinner yet but its gonna have rosemary in it!" I was so excited. I just started cutting.. just snip snip snip and the wonder and joy I felt while doing this could be compared to a kid in a toy store. Wide eyed and overjoyed. They are a normal size, the finger holes are perfect. It has a great cover to protect the blades after use that lock on so no fear of it falling off. They are easy to clean. So far I have enjoyed playing with my new toy. My love for my herb garden grew 10 times.

WOW! <-- That word does not even begin to describe my love for this kit. I am a mom and wife. I like to cook for my family and anyone in my position knows that you can get stuck in a rut. I have tried to cook with Curry and make is taste as authentic as possible, but there was never any direction or understanding about the spices. I mean I have a jar of anise seeds in my cupboard forever but have no idea what they are used for. Until now! I finally understand what cardamom is and why it has such a potent smell but fabulous taste, I now know that chili powder isn't just for beans anymore. I have a new love for whole fresh spices!With this kit you get a nice round tin, the spice box, in this are small dishes that hold the individual spices. Now it comes packaged so you get to clean up the spice box and dishes and slowly add the bag of spice to each one. I really enjoyed doing this. They sit nicely in the tin and are easy to just take a pinch or a measurement from.There is a book that comes with it. A real actual very vibrant pictured book, with real recipes. So far I have cooked the Chicken Curry (as in pic attached), Broccoli and Onion Curry, and the Cauliflower and Peas Curry. I don't wanna give to much away, but the book has some very good information and is easy to follow.My husband and kids loved all the recipes I have tried so far. As a matter of a fact my husband said something along the lines of "Ever since you got that Kitchen Curry Master Set all the dinners have tasted great! Are you gonna use that more often?" Needless to say trying my hand at authentic Curry dishes is a winner in this household. I have succeeded in trying something that I was completely foreign to and feeling like a Master after using this set.

As with any stay at home mom I am sure I am not the only one trying to organize her life with three kids running around. Though there are times I am extremely grateful we don't have sports just yet. I still have to keep up with a schedule. Between blogging, playdates, rehearsals, and the common household chores one can get a little overwhelmed. First of all I loved the binding and the front and back hard book this is. Secondly I absolutely adore the beautiful words of encouragement all through out this wonderful organizer. The prompts for being grateful, for being positive are right up my ally of love and wholesomeness. I was surprised at all the great detail this encourages for organization. I do wish the pages were replaceable or that the months weren't assigned to pages. I unfortunately received it half way through the year and would've loved to use start to finish. But I did receive a purchase coupon to review it. I must say that my favorite part is the way it encourages you to be happy. Just the sayings alone are enough to make you want to pick it up and start writing, organizing, and straightening life out a little bit. The vision tactic is helpful and keeps you goal oriented. Plus it is 100% recycled which for an earth conscious person like me is important.  I have been using it regularly and am loving it. If it works out will probably look into getting one for next year.. but start the year off with the organizer.

This family of mine, bikes and more bikes.. rides and more rides.. bike lights and more bike lights. Now mind you we live out in the country and ride on a lot of dirt trails and country roads. So the kids needing lights is more of a way to get around the woods when the lights getting dim on the property. I can't tell you how many we have purchased. My youngest had his tail light break and I was just about to buy a new one when I saw these being offered at a discount to be reviewed and was excited to try them. I have purchased other light products from AOR and know they are a brand I have enjoyed using before. My son saw these and knew they were for him. He opened the package and ran to put them on his bike, he is 4 years old. They just happened to come around a weekend we were having BBQ with friends and late night bike rides in the woods with the daddies. I figured if my 4 yr old son could figure out how to get these on his bike then he could ride with them as long as he wanted to. Unfortunately the taillight died and needed a new battery after just a short time of using it. But it was an easy enough fix. Haven't had a problem again. I like how they are an easy push on and off button. I like the pliable feel and how it grips onto the handle bars and seat post nicely. There were no worries of it falling off.

I live on the beautiful Northern California Coast and as beautiful as our beaches are I swear we don't get to go enough. When we do go however, we take kites. There is never a doubt in our mind that at the beach there will be enough wind to suspend a kite. Normally however the kites we get are ones that Nana sends to the kids. They are dollar tree plastic kites. While we take care so we always have them. There are those times when the plastic rips or the strands tear off, or even the braces break. When I saw this kite was being offered at a discount for an honest review my first thoughts were, "YAY an Actual KITE for the beach!!" Then it got me thinking about why there aren't any kite shops in the area, but I digress. So it was time to go fly the new kite. The kids were super excited and a little bummed there was only one. I let them know that if this was a go then we would definitely be getting 2 more (I have 3 kids). We got down there and immediately was able to put the kite together with ease. Super understandable directions for an easy to build kite.  The fabric was durable and the wind picked it up with out a care. The kids loved seeing the colors fly in the sky. We anchored the kite and just let it flap in the wind for a good while. It comes with reusable packaging to put the kite in when you are done and store for later use. Which for us was the next couple days.  Definitely going be looking in to getting a couple more kites from this company.

This is the perfect little flash light for our family. We have three very active children. Sometimes sleeping on the trampoline is a must do. Well we normally have a nice camping lantern they use. Alas the batteries were dead. So I let the kids use this cute little flashlight instead. It worked out great. The kids were able to see what they were doing but still able to fall asleep because the lantern was not to bright. Of course we did have it on the low setting. I was able to get it after they fell asleep and use the flash light end to go lock up our chickens. Since then it has been my go to light for going outside in the dark. I have already put in on my list of must haves to go in our camping gear. It is light weight and compact. The handle is just right for hanging off of places so you can be hands free. I am so happy I was selected to review this item at a discount price. Now I know which company to go to for my light needs. AOR is a wonderful company and have yet to buy a product I didn't love.

This Mat is Amazing! Now I do not do yoga on a daily basis but a few times a week I do enjoy it. This mat is Eco Friendly, Durable, and Just the right size. I have gone through numerous mats. They end up shredding where my feet are. So when I got the opportunity to use this item and review at a discount price I jumped on it. Well the deal and the mat.Anyhow, I loved how when I took it out of the box and wrapper it didn't have a chemical smell at all. It smelled nice, clean, and sweet. Then to learn about how it is made from recycled materials and the environmentally friendliness of the product I was hooked.Then it was time to use it. I popped in my Yoga DVD played out the mat and started doing my yoga. Now again the smell came in handy when doing the Vinyasa. It was nice, thick, and just the right length. It didn't slip when jumping to my feet or back into plank. I can tell that it isn't going to shred the way my other matts have.This mat is just amazing. I look forward to using it many more times when doing my yoga routines.

Oh my! My husband is a 4 am coffee drinker. I am an 8 am coffee drinker (I get the cold reheated coffee pot leftovers)! He is a bean grinding, percolating grounds, dark roast, splash of cream, hard working, coffee drinking man. He is very particular about his coffee as well. If it doesn't taste like it will put hair on his chest then it won't work. So when this showed up he was a little leery at first. He does have his regular brand and to try something different caused a little anxiety mixed with a little excitement.So fast forward and it is time to open the bag. A Saturday morning so I could also enjoy the fresh brewed coffee, rather than the leftovers. Nice smell, definitely the small of dark roast beans. He grabs a handful, a little oily but no worries, puts it in the grinder. He admires the nice dark color of the grounds. I can see the excitement rise in him. He grinds them a little finer this time. I think at this point the words "Espresso Blend" is sticking with him. I remind him though that these will be percolated not pressed. I don't think he cared. Then it was time to put the grounds in the filter and turn on the coffee pot. I could have cut the anticipation with a knife it was so thick and heavy. The time came and he poured his cup but this time without cream. He says he has to fully experience the 100% Guatemalan Coffee Flavor. He licks his lips and closes his eyes. He loves it.. Hey Mikey He likes it!! Anyhow. He said it had a slight hint of bitterness but a nice robust full bodied flavor he would want from a dark roast. He said it was hair on the chest flavor and a winner. I had a nice taste and I agree. Though I can do without the hair on my chest.Now the only reason I would dare attempt to have my husband try another brand of coffee is because I received a generous discount in exchange for an honest review. With my husband I knew it would be an honest review, cause he can be very critical about his coffee. I am thoroughly glad he enjoyed it and even said that when I decide to switch the flavor again to get this brand.. YAY!!!!

My husband is a construction worker and there are times he has to run a jack hammer or a concrete vibrator. After doing this kind of work he often comes home with achy hands and wrists. Now when I was offered a coupon for this bracelet in return for an honest review I thought what better person to try it on than my husband. Not to mention both of us are huge fans of Celtic design. I thought if he doesn't wear it, then I will. Well he hasn't taken it off. He has even taken it to work with him so it goes back on his wrist as soon as he is off work. He says that it has been helping relieve the joint pain he has in his wrist after work. He has another plain copper bracelet from Earth Therapy that he wears all the time so when he saw this and the cool Celtic design he was excited. Now if I could get him to let me try it out.. oh my wrist aches.. I think I need to wear the bracelet. Hasn't worked yet but it is so darn cute. Of course it is a little big because it is meant to fit a man, but it is also adjustable. Anyhow he loves it and it helps that is the most important part.

So my husband and I both have knee problems. He blew his knee out in High School playing football and has had surgery but it still aches. I put a tear in my ACL in my 20s playing Basketball and then it completely detached about 5 yrs later while I was pretending to be a Ninja Warrior in my back yard. So when there was a discount offer for this Copper Compression Knee Sleeve I was excited to get it. I got a large and though it fits nicely it does cut into my top thigh. I wore it for a couple of my workouts and I feel it really helped with the ache I get during my workouts. Then it was my husbands turn. He likes to ride his Bike in the Mountainous unpredictable single track terrain we have around here. After his rides his knee is quite achy. Well he does not go for a ride without this sleeve on. As a matter of a fact if I want to wear it.. I have to "buy a new one". So if that doesn't just give the product A+ status in my book. I had never thought of using a copper compression sleeve for my workouts and now I don't know what else I will do. For the athlete or just a person who loves to be fit. This is a great sleeve to wear. It stays in place and is not bulky, it is very thin and comfortable. All the while delivering some healing benefit and compression.
It was actually a little big.. BUT I LOVE IT!! Super cute an plan on wearing it a lot.

I grow a lot of my own herbs. Normally I would use a mortar and pestle to grind my dried herbs to use in my dishes. I received this product during a promotional period and was eager to use it. I LOVE IT. The stevia for my tea ground to perfection without leaving green blobs in my teeth. The basil and oregano perfect for my sauces.. It even has a screen that catches the fine powder. Nothing goes to waste. I am still new at using it but LOVE how well it has ground our herbs. Definitely easier and more user friendly than the mortar.

I was looking for some cotton leggings and for the price really liked these. I am pleased with the fit and the style. My only complaint is they are REALLY thin. So definitely need to be worn with a long tunic or some sort of covering. Unless you want people to know what, if any, kind of underwear you have on. I would recommend them and would be in to purchasing them again.

10 out of 10 would stick the finger up there again. Not to say the hubby was to comfortable with the idea but hey when it's time to spice things up you try new things. Not that checking his prostate was on his list of spicing things up. Nice product. Had no odor, water soluble ( a little more saliva makes it last), not sticky and no taste. When you are shopping Lubricant I suggest giving it a try. I know this is our go to bottle in times of sauciness!

I have used my previous eyelash curler for years until my daughter pulled out the foam and pulled it apart. It was time for a new one. I saw this and was willing to give it a go. First I would like to say I love the grips, or finger placements. They are much more comfortable than the round finger holes like most other curlers. Second I love how the insert isn't foam but more of a rubber material. I heat my curler with the blow dryer, or stick it in my bra while applying my makeup, and this held the heat a lot better than foam. It did curl my lashes wonderfully. The only reason I didn't give it for stars is because my eye sockets are a little shallow, and lashes are short and it was pinching my skin in order for me to get close enough to the root to curl properly. However after a few tries and adjustments I got it. I loved how it curled my lashes. I even applied less mascara than usual. So far it is comfortable to hold and with a little finagling easy to use with great results.

I have never been one to "do" my eyebrows. Yet as I age I can see how it is something I would be interested in doing. The problem with this product is that it came with ZERO instructions. I don't know how to apply it. No website to direct me to. So it has just sat there. I have googled a few videos to no success for this particular product. Hopefully I find a way to apply and use it so I can actually review the product itself.

Anyone who is anyone could use a little trimmer for their waist. I received this and was anxious to try it. I put it on immediately. I could tell right away that it gave some great lumbar support and I instantly started sweating. The next morning I put it on during my workout. I was sure it was going to be uncomfortable and get in my way. It didn't though. I forgot that I even had it on and that was through scissor kicks, burpees, downward dog and all. My skin was soaked but not dripping. I did take some before and will take some after shots. Hoping it will increase my results. I even used it during my choir practice so it would remind me engage my core and diaphragm, as well as provide the support I needed while sitting. All in all this is a very comfortable belt.

I received this about a week ago and have enjoyed it so far. The capsules are an easy to swallow size. The ingredients are simple and nothing that I can't find a natural source for. They do not smell. The directions/suggested use is great because it eases you into the dosage. I am hoping for some great results. My only hesitation is I LOVE the taste of coffee and it asks to refrain from coffee. This is hard for me.. but I am doing the best I can hoping it won't skew my results. I can't wait to update with some results.

My 2 girls least favorite time of day is when it is time to brush their hair. I get a million excuses as to why it is not going to happen. I have a million reasons why it DOES need to happen. I resorted to soft bristle brushes, but they don't get all the way through my girls thick hair. Both have different hair. One blonde with stick straight but VERY thick hair.. the other curly/wavy brown VERY thick hair. So I needed to find a brush that works for both. I was told about these and ordered. They look like regular hair brushes so I was a little skeptical. I especially loved that 2 came in the box so they would each have their own. So the time came, showers were over and they dodged me as usual. I got the box and asked them to pick blue or pink. Handed them the brush of the color they chose and told them to try it. I was met with resistance and whines. I just asked them to try it and so they did. Not only were they surprised but so was I.. There wasn't a sound of worry coming from them at all. The brushes glided through their hair with ease. They still give me a little resistance because it looks like a regular brush, but when I remind them of how easy it is they are ready to brush their hair. I think our hair problems are going to come to an end.

Let me start by saying this book was easy to read and the language was very understandable as well. I did find it to be a bit repetitive in parts and could have used a bit more editing. Only a few spelling mistakes. I was expecting more of a guide on how to start or work an online business but found more of a personal journey. Now that being said reading her journey was exciting and she was quite entertaining in her telling of experiences. I was hoping for more of a platform to use, but nonetheless I did learn a thing or two about her journey. The book is entertaining and if you are doing any business through eBay or Amazon I would suggest giving it a read. As it is very easy to follow and get a good idea of things that could or would happen. Overall I enjoyed the book.

I liked this book for the way it explains the sabbats and esbats but it is very short. I was hoping for more content. It is very short and only has a little on the magical working associated with the seasons. Not to disappointed just want more. It says encyclopedia but is a small one!

So far, of the three wine bottles we had readily available, this pourer/stand doesn't fit any of them. We didn't think that would be an issue, and we didn't see anything on Amazon's listing otherwise, so I'm a bit confused.It came in a plain black box with no paper. Elegant, but confusing. I realize you really don't need instructions for this, but considering none of our wine bottles (the shortest of which still doesn't fit in this) fit, I'm perplexed. I don't know if there's a way to change the curve to allow larger (or, rather, "standard" size) bottles, but if there is I don't know how.For now, we have it in the box since we have no wine bottles that fit. It's pretty and seems sturdy enough, but until we get a bottle, I'll leave this review as is. If I find one, I'll update accordingly.

Literally. Right after our daughter was born she was placed in Huggies diapers. They've been our go-to, and we know they're our preference as we've tried other brands.This size 1 never snaps or breaks, and so far it's contained all waste neatly. The only incidents we've had are related to user error.The only regret I have is the price, but you get what you pay for: quality diapers that are worth their weight, no matter what's inside!

We got this to replace our old camera, which had been knocked over. It worked well enough, but the antennae kept falling apart after the incident, and by that time it was well past its warranty.We didn't realize how much more that one had than this model, especially considering they're both around the same price.Right out of the box, though, my wife and I noticed how sturdy this one seemed. It's small, but it has some weight and over the past month we haven't had it budge from its spot at all. We use ours as a kids monitor. As such, we don't mind that this stands out. It's bright white, and has LEDs for night vision. When we need to, we use it as a security camera when we're away for long periods of time. It'll make do.Compared to our previous camera, this one was a LOT easier to set up. Because it has its own app, the camera and our phones synced perfectly and instantly. Before, we had to pick and choose from various apps since the camera didn't have its own. It was cumbersome and confusing, so we welcome this change. As far as IP cameras go, this one was easier to set up. I would still like to use this camera on a browser, but I haven't ventured into that, if at all possible.It doesn't do as much as my old camera at the same price (namely, rotate), and the cloud feature makes me wary to the point that I turn it off when I don't need it, but it's a good, sturdy little replacement for our previous model.

These are FAR easier to use on toddlers than baby diapers. They're great in that they're easy to slip on and off, but, like regular Huggies, have amazing absorption as well as the straps.Because our toddler has transitioned to underwear, she's used to that, but for nighttime we like to use these until she's wetbed-free.We've purchased more and couldn't be happier with Huggies. We've been using their brand since she was born.

The watch is a beautiful gold-colored stainless-steel timepiece, but the face is a LOT bigger than I was expecting. While I was expecting a large face, and I had gotten a pretty big watch recently, I was still surprised by how big this watch is. I'm a pretty small guy at 5'9" with slender wrists, so this watch is a bit big for me. I'm planning on wearing it at the occasional formal business event, ones where only executives are attending, but for now it'll stay snug in its box.It doesn't have that many features compared to others in the pricepoint, but it's a fine piece that screams attention. The numerals don't seem as elegant as the rest of the watch, and, to be truthful, kind of give it a cheap look, but the gold and black design is pretty enough.Would be better if you have beefier hands than me. I sport modest watches, and this one is really pushing the limits, but I'll find some good use for it!

I've owned a memory foam pillow and have slept on memory foam mattresses, but this is the first time I've owned one. It came in a rather large box (expectedly), and was wrapped tightly like a carpet.Once we had the bed platform set up, getting this on the bed was pretty easy. All you have to do is cut the outer plastic and it unrolls. There's another plastic cover underneath and over the mattress; we cut it open to get to the instructions, which were on display in Spanish only, only to turn it over and find the English version, which indicated that you have to let it set for 24-72 hours before cutting the other plastic. Whoops.Thankfully, we didn't remove that second plastic cover all the way.The mattress inflated to the full 10 inches within 24 hours. We slept on it the first night, but the plastic was a nuisance. The second night was great, and is very comfortable. There's some give and the mattress isn't too firm. It's a bit soft to lie down and read comfortably, but it's great for sleeping. Which, of course, is what it's meant for initially.

I'm a coffee lover but I'm absolutely awful at making coffee. I've always stuck to instant NesCafe when making my own, even though I'm such a critic when it comes to tasting coffee brewed by a hand other than my own.I've used a method at home for brewing single cups, and while I wait to get a press method machine, I've opted to obtain an espress maker for now.

Haven't used protein in a few years, but the last one I used was Optimum Nutrition's 100% Gold Standard Whey. That seems to be the most popular, and it gave me adequate results. Being a member of Vine, I'm always eager to try new things, and when I had a chance to try new protein I jumped on the offer.

Being of Mexican heritage *and* from Chicago, I have a special place for Rick in my heart. My whole family does.We make our own guacamole, and different variants of the ingredients, too. Mashing avocados is one of the important parts, and this masher is not joking around.Right out of the box, this thing is sturdy. It means business. The steel masher is thicker than any steel kitchen utensil we own, and sturdy enough to bludgeon someone with. The wood handle is great, though I can't tell how thick it is inside. The red handle is nice and gives it a better grip when you're mashing stuff.So far we've used it only to mash what we call "the mix," and that was inside an aluminium bowl. The masher worked quite well, though we're not going to use it to mash anything inside steel again; this steel is far stronger than our bowls that it actually left scratches inside. Lesson learned.At least we don't need to worry about this utensil's lifespan.

I was a bit hesitant to order this watch because of its big, bold face, but I ordered it anyway. I have fairly slender wrists, so I wasn't sure how it'd look, whether it would be too large. That, and the color. IT's called Rose Gold, so I was afraid it would look too pink.But when it arrived I could not have been any happier. The color of the band is more of a light bronze, which--come on. What man wouldn't want a watch of bronze?! The face is big, true, but it's not so big as to be gaudy. For reference, I'm 5'8", 160lbs. I have fairly slender joints, and am able to grip entirely around my wrists. I had to remove four links from this watch to make it fit properly.The time so far has kept its accuracy for the time I've had it. The only other watch over $100 I own is a basic Movado, and all that does it tell the time and date. This is the first time I've had a watch that had twisted knobs to change the settings, and well as the band that had push levers to loosen. I'm actually pretty excited about trying these features that I'm sure are standard in many watches today.The only part of the watch I haven't set yet is the world time. I haven't figured out yet, even though the instructions are clear, but I plan on doing that shortly. I just haven't traveled yet so I've no emergent need of this feature.The only gripe I have about it is that the day of the week is sometimes hard to read. Because the hands are so big and the day of the week is in written circular, with a hand of their own, I have to stare at the watch for a second more to remind myself of the day of week. Not a big deal, but still something I should point out.The weight isn't too heavy. The only time I remember I have it on is when I've been speed-walking for a long time and I have to wave my arms out wide. Otherwise, it's not as heavy on the wrist, though it definitely has gravity when you set it down on a table or something.

I had gotten into Gundam kits only within the last decade and worked my way up through HG kits. This was the first non-humanoid I had worked on; I was both nervous and excited to see how it'll turn out.It took me as long as any more recent HG kit, though there was a lot of repetition as the legs were mostly the same. The hind and fore legs were slightly different, but only toward the joints where they connected to the torso.The three heads were also similar initially, though the main head has some slight variation. The wings are fun to use, and overall I love how the joints work on this kit. A very good kit if you're looking to steer away from the typical Gundam robots.

When I was a kid I really, really wanted the Dragonzord. Who didn't? I envied my friends who had one, and, while I did get some sweet Zords later on, the Green Ranger's robot was never mine.Many years later, after I graduate college and landed my first job, I used some of my spare change to acquire stuff I've always wanted but never had. The Dragonzord was one of them. It was a prized possession for many years; even when the Legacy Dragonzord was announced I scoffed at it and never desired to own one sine the original '90s version was all I needed.Yet, somehow, the Legacy version grew on me over the months and when I had the chance to get a slightly used one at a handsome discount I jumped on the offer.When I got him I was not disappointed. The condition was fantastic--almost new, even. Anyway, not going to banter about my transaction.What I love most about this version is that there are no stickers and everything is sculpted and painted. The Dragonzord now looks the proper Dragon Caesar rather than the MMPR thunderbolt-stickered toy, even though this was made by Bandai of America and not by Bandai [of Japan]. It comes with the regular rocket hands that the old '90s version came with, but now it also comes with a second set of interchangeable hands. This second set replicates how the Dragonzord's hands looked normally; that is, the regular humanoid curled hands. This is what I use all the time when my Dragonzord is on display.The overall figure is now more svelte and looks like it jumped right out of the show. It's about 90% perfect in my eyes.Now on to the 10% that's not so perfect.The original Dragonzord leaned forward a bit, but not by much. This Dragonzord leans forward even more, so when you have him standing regularly it seems like he's looking down. You can correct this by bending the knees and then he's standing all the way straight, but then the knees look very awkward compared to the original toy and how the Dragonzord/Caesar looked in the show. Many complained about how long the tail is, and it is very long, but it was also long in the show. What Bandai could've done, however, is allow half of it to detach so that when you transform the tail into the drill it's not that long. I guess Bandai was trying to prioritize the segmented joints--which work wonderfully--and didn't have the engineering to allow that and complete detachment.Because this is a more modernization of the original '90s toy, there's not much more articulation. There is die-cast, but I feel he could've used less on the feet as they weigh him down in certain transformations. The jaw also reveals the face inside more than the original, which is a bit weird, but I pose him with his mouth closed anyway.The joints feel a bit looser than I'd like. I presume this is to allow the Zord Builder functionality, though my opinion is that that feature should've been left out. But that's me.Otherwise, this is about as perfect as he can get right now. The only way I can see more improvement is if Bandai in Japan decided to create him with modern articulation and transformation. I know they can do it; I've seen it with other robots. But, considering how much more popular MMPR is here over the popularity of Zyuranger in Japan, I don't see it happening any time soon.But for collectors who grew up loving Tommy, this can't be beat.

The jar of this cream is huge!  There is no doubt that this will last a while, which might explain the high price tag. You don‚Äôt need much of the cream as too much of the cream makes the scent overwhelming. The overwhelming scent was a bit much for me as I don‚Äôt usually wear strong smelling lotions or creams. The scent lasted the entire day and made my skin feel smooth.

We actually have a surplus of these from a previous purchase when they were on sale at a local store, and we also had a coupon. I didn't realize I was ordering the same ones from Amazon, but at least I didn't order too many more.We've got a tiny garbage can in the kitchen and a larger one right outside to hold the smaller garbage bags when they're full. We haven't found perfect ones for our can. Either the bag is tough but has a lousy drawstring, or the bag is weak and has a fantastic drawstring. This Hefty Extra Strong bag is of the former class.I am never worried that the bag will rip when I carry the bag out to the trash, but the drawstrings themselves sometimes rip or, when I put a new bag in the can, they never grip the lip of the can and the first trash put it in it always cause the bag to slip in a bit.Most of the time I end up closing the bag without the drawstring and carry the bag by the top itself without the strings. A bit more of an inconvenience, but nothing to pine over.Still, the search for the perfect bag continues.

I'm awful at math. The last math course I took was Trig in college, and that was over a decade ago. My math has gotten rusty since, though there was a summer where I brushed up a bit due to the GRE. But that, too, was a while ago, so I decided recently I really ought to put more attention in this area.Once I was able to search for some workbooks, I found this one through Vine and decided to order it. I figured 6th and 8th grade math can't be too hard--right?It starts off right in the middle of some algebra, with a quick lesson to get you up and running and gauge your abilities at the moment. I admit it was tougher than I thought but only because I had forgotten a lot of the terminology. Once I was able to memorize them, however, the algebra came back to me and I solved most the problems correctly at first try.The book is divided into chapters, though sometimes it's hard to tell which chapter/section you're in. I do one a night and I feel it's a good pace for me, but some sections last one page or two, and often I found myself skipping into the next night's assignment simply because I didn't realize I was doing another set.There is an answer key in the back to grade yourself. I think it's a great book for people like me to refresh their algebra skills, and I most certainly am going to order another once I'm finished with this book (about a little over halfway with this one).

I'm a big fan of the Nick Turtles. I grew up with the '80s Turtles show and the subsequent trilogy, and later on I read the Mirage comics. I also played Turtles in Time feverishly on the SNES.When Nickelodeon bought the rights to the Turtles I was a bit hesitant. I wasn't sure what they'd do with the property, and so when they announced that they were going to do a new show I was cautiously optimistic, to use the term.By the end of the first season I knew it was the best incarnation of the Turtles in film form. It's a bit cheating, however, as they take elements from previous Turtles runs, but they don't run on pure nostalgia. They meld the best of the best all the while refining them and creating their own mark in the Turtle timeline.As a figure collector I knew I had to have these Turtles, and I sometimes dreamt that a Japanese manufacturer would someday obtain the rights to create them. Playmates did an adequate job in making inexpensive figures before the show began and they were suitable. But when Kaiyodo announced the Turtles for their Revoltech line I knew I had to snatch them up. While I prefer Max Factory and Bandai to Kaiyodo, I pre-ordered them anyway as I'm not sure the other two will create them.Anyway, on to the figure.These are far superior to any of the Nick Turtles we've got, and for those complaining about fragility please be aware that these are meant for adult collectors. Model kits are very fragile, yet they are catered to both adults and children, with the simpler kits often meant for the latter. Consider these Japanese figures in such a way, except that these are kits that are pre-built, professionally painted, and finely packaged.All the joints are Revolver joints, as expected, with the smaller joints having less resistance to provide for easier movement and less stress against the plastic. There's even a joint in the bandana to allow the eyes to move. These are my first Revoltech figures with movable eyes since Woody, so I'm not sure if this is the direction Kaiyodo is taking with moving eyes from here on out.That said, what I love about the movable eyes is that if you move the bandana far enough to one side the eyes will become completely white, allowing for that "fight mode" viewers have come to love from the Nick show.The primary limb joints are the standard Revolver joints common in most figures, so don't expect these Turtles to seem accurate when in relaxed poses. People often complain about Revoltech's joints, arguing that they're frustrating to manipulate and they hinder the figure from posing in more natural humanoid stances. That's not the purpose of these joints. Rather, their positioning and sculpting is meant to give them more dynamic, even less-natural, poses than are usually allowed. So while the Turtles can't pose worth a boot when standing normally, expect to give them excellent articulation into flying, jumping, and kicking moves.The accessories are excellent, and I love the included heads with each Turtle. Leo has his shocked face, but be aware that you'll have to remove the bandana for each head as there's only one included.The pizza accessory can break apart into separate pieces, and each piece has specific indents into the platter so there's no confusion as to which piece goes where. I didn't think it was necessary to have the individual slices come with singular indents, but whatever.The only thing that I found didn't work well, and why I gave this figure one less star, is that the katana sheaths don't stay on Leo's back. No matter how many different times and ways I've tried putting them on his back, they don't stay on, or at least they do when only one is placed (they come as separate sheaths rather than both combined into one). It kind of ruins the look as Leo is seen almost always with them on his back, with swords or no, but I'm not sure if that's just my specific figure.The box designs are nice and they line up nicely against each other on a bookshelf, with a bust of each Turtle taken straight out of the show on all left sides. I'm not a fan of the simple window design, as the older Revoltech figures came with a book-style cover that opened to reveal the window underneath.Anyway, that's my review. I love these Turtles, and they're my second-favorite TMNT figures after the NECA versions.

A friend of ours introduced us to Anberlin about a decade ago. "They kind of sound like Linkin Park," she told me. I gave it a go, but quickly deduced they sounded nothing like Linkin Park. Still, I loved their music right away. Never Take Friendship Personal was the first album I listened to, though not the first song. It wasn't until later I realized one of their songs from their first album was in a sampler I owned, and I recall liking that song a lot.But I digress.This was the go-to album for me when recommending music for a long time, at least until Cities released. There wasn't a song on here I didn't like, and the album grew on me more and more over time. To this day it's one of my favorite albums, and I would say it would be Anberlin's best if Cities didn't exist.Even for the people to whom I recommended this album they'd recommend to others this as well.Once, when my friends and I were in car ride traveling from state to state, I decided to put this album on when it was my turn for music selection. The driver, who was a very hard person to please, paused mid-conversation and uttered, "Shh, wait. I like this song."Well, now I realize this isn't really a review more than it is my experience with this CD. Oh, well.

I had never heard of the Eagle Creek brand before this product.  I was excited to try this bag as I usually wear comfortable to shoes to work and change into my work shoes when I get to work.  This bag was great for transporting my work shoes to and from work.  I am a size 8.5 women's shoe and both flats and high heels fit perfectly into the bag.  I wouldn't be able to fit two pairs of shoes though.  I could see possibly fitting two pairs of flips flops in this bag, but definitely not two pairs of regular shoes.  They'd be too squished and I'd be afraid I'd damage my shoes. It's nice and lightweight which is convenient considering I have several other bags to carry with me to work.  I love this bag and will continue to carry my work shoes in it.  I'm sure it could be used for other purposes as well (e.g. carrying socks, small amounts of clothes, other shoes, etc.). I'm a bit of a cheapskate so the price is a little high for me, but I see this bag as being durable and lasting a long time.

I live in an apartment in a 150-year-old building. The electrical hasn't been updated in quite a long time, and the walls are solid thick. I love the anatomy and life of the building, but man is it a killer for electronics. They weren't meant to be in a building like this, but I refuse to let them go and need to boost most of them with Internet.My wife does work and takes classes at home, and I take home the occasional odd job, so the Internet is a necessity. And when we like to have down time we stream videos in different rooms; we have the modem and main router set up in the living room, which is at one end of the apartment, and we have a smaller range extender set up half of the way. The Internet certainly was boosted, and I never got any more dropped signals from my office (which is at the other end of the apartment).Still, the signal wasn't the strongest, and occasionally I'd get weak Internet from my already-premium subscription.So then this extender arrived.The previous extender was set in our bedroom, which is exactly half of the distance between the apartment, and that's where this Linksys extender came in. I was surprised at how easy it was to set up, though it did take a few tries before it was set properly. At first I didn't notice that stark a difference, but a few days later I realized my pages loaded faster and I was able to download more files for work at a quicker pace (not sure if doing more work faster is a good thing, but you get my point).Before getting this my laptop would get three bars max in my office; I now have a full five and haven't seen a drop since.The outlet I have this plugged into was placed incorrectly and is upside down. I know how to turn it around but I'm too lazy, but thankfully the antennae can rotate all the way around, so I have the extender upside-down and the arms facing upward.The colors change throughout the day but they stay mostly a lime-green. I haven't tried the outlet pass-through yet; however, I don't think I ever will. I trust the Wi-Fi extending powers, but I'm not certain about the electricity power as I don't want the old wiring to cause a short or anything.

I haven't acquired a kids' board game in some years, but when I saw this edition I couldn't pass it up.At the time, I was living with my parents, having just graduated college, and the only other person to enjoy this game with me was my 7-year-old kid sister. I hadn't played Trouble in a while, but it's a very familiar game with very basic instructions. My sister got the hang of it right away.I'm not the biggest fan of the CGI-version Clone Wars (I prefer the Tartakovsky version), but since it's pretty much the only Star Wars-themed Trouble I got it, though mostly for R2-D2.R2-D2 has an on/off switch if you get annoyed by him. There's still the regular dice in there, and I never got tired of hearing little R2 chirp.What bothered me the most was the quality. For $10 at my local Wally's World I wasn't expecting much, but it was worse than the regular editions of Trouble I had seen. There's no plastic over the cardboard layout, and you have to apply stickers to the pawns which is a bummer; I'd rather have etched pawns.For $10-$15 it's not bad if you're a Star Wars geek and have kids. Since playing this when I initially bought it many years ago, I've gotten married and had a daughter, who this years is turning 3. I think it's safe to bring this game out of the basement to give it a whirl again.

Back when HeartGold and SoulSilver were announced I was super excited. Pok√©mon Gold is my favorite in the series and I had been hoping for years for a remake, at least ever since the Red and Green remakes were released.So the games were announced but after that Nintendo announced these neat little gadgets that would pair with the games and the DS. I thought it was neat that they were shaped like Poke Balls and would go around with you as a pedometer.Back when it released I used it extensively for the first few months. It was extremely easy to use for its time, and the battery lasted for years.The games were terse and sweet, and effective for catching select Pok√©mon.Over time its usefulness and novelty grew stale, but it still acted as an excellent pedometer. The screen is extremely crisp and the game works flawlessly with the accessory.

My daughter is two years old and has been using regular cups for a few months now. We keep an eye on her when she does, but when she drinks on her own and likes to wander around we let her take cups with lids. They're especially useful when carrying out and in the car.We have quite a few but ordered these as well when we had the chance. Build quality they are very good. We have other Munchkin products and they're all very good quality.Functionality is a different story, but these aren't too bad.What makes these cups stand out is the lid. I've never seen a lid like this, but it doesn't mean it isn't common. We just don't own too many variations of Sippy cups.The plastic piece screws on like any other lid, but there's a softer part on top that keeps the liquid from spilling out. When first I washed these I couldn't tell how they worked. They came in just a bag in the Amazon box so I had no clue how they worked. It's simple, however, once I got the hang of it: just drink as you normally would a cup, except you have to suck on it as well.The ones we had worked only on certain angles, but it worked in the end. My daughter got the hang of it almost immediately, although she was confused only because of the way it looked as she never had seen cups as such.Because it didn't come with any instructions or anything I can't--or rather haven't--removed the softer part from the plastic lid when I wash them. I don't know whether they're supposed to, but I didn't try placing too much force when pulling for fear of ripping them.Thus, they may mold over time, but by then we'll probably have moved on from Sippy cups.

Have had the same AAA batteries for about four years now and the only reason I'm needing to get more is because I have more accessories which require AAA.Having good rechargeable batteries is one thing, but having a good charger is just as important. I've had the same one since purchasing my first set of eneloops and it's running great. Keeps the batteries running at optimal health. I think the brand name is La Crosse.

Why they didn't include a headphone jack in the SP is beyond me. Considering it's now an older device, I can't ask. If you do want to use headphones, however, you are going to need either Nintendo's headphones (or any third-party SP headphones) or this little adapter to use any headphones you want.The quality is fine, but it can range as there are a lot of knock-offs and third-party versions. The official Nintendo one looks like the one in this listing, and also has the "Nintendo" stamp on the part that plugs into the SP. The female jack is also gold-colored and doesn't protrude from the adapter at all.The quality of the adapter can make all the difference, even if the SP isn't exactly stereo quality.The first one I bought was a knock-off; I knew it was because it didn't have the "Nintendo" stamp, but it was close enough. The official ones are a little hard to come by nowadays, but they're not expensive once they do pop up.The old one I had sometimes didn't align properly in the SP slot. I've since gotten the official one, and it fits just right without any wiggle.

I had a case for my DS Lite from Kmart which I had purchased when I first got my handheld. That was back in 2007. It was perfect for me. It was a strongly tinted clear blue hard case that had two sections and a single tab in the front which released those flaps. The top portion held a few DS cartridges and an extra stylus, while the bottom held the handheld itself. The entire interior was insulated with a soft rubber-like material. It was perfect, except for one flaw.That mentioned tab in the middle was pretty thin so after a couple of years it would break right down the middle, preventing the case from remaining shut, thus rendering the case's primary function (to keep the handheld safe inside) relatively dysfunctional.I bought another of the same case right away, fearing they wouldn't make it anymore and convincing myself it was a fluke. Thankfully I found one of the last ones at my local Kmart but, again, a couple of years later the same issue happened.So I finally caved in and looked on Amazon. The top-rated DS Lite case was the same one I found when I initially looked for cases. The main reason it didn't attract me was the big brand name on top and no middle flap to separate the top from the bottom. But I caved and ordered one, hoping this would be the last DS Lite case I ever order.It's mostly the same as the previous cases I had. The outer shell seems to be made of the same material, as well as the interior insulation. I did notice that the inside produced a distinct smell when first I opened it, and the smell still lingers even after a few years.The top holds DS cartridges, though I don't really carry around my games anymore since I restrict myself to one game when I'm on the go. Still, for those that carry games please note that only four of the six slots are used for DS cartridges. The other two, the ones in the middle, are used for SD cards. Why they did that is beyond me. Does the DSi carry SD cards? If so, I can't imagine people will be carrying more than one with them.The bottom of the top holds a spare stylus in case you need it, which is where I put one of the two styli my DS came with.The closing and opening button is a lot better than the previous cases', and I can tell I probably won't have to fear with it breaking. The "Intec" name on top is a real bummer, as I hate big brand names on my merchandise. I get it's their product and they made it, but something more subtle would've been nice.

We were going to use it to hold newspapers and magazines, but the day after we had taken it out it was filled instead with toys. My toddler daughter took it and used to transport her own goods.It's smaller than I thought it was going to be, and very stiff, but considering it's now used mostly by my daughter to carry toys I don't mind much.

I don't have the exact version in this listing. Rather, I found one at Target and it's made by Power A and is even titles Mini Transporter Case. But to be exact the one I found at Target was $9.99, blue (came in black and pink as well), and didn't have the full front and back compartments like this listing shows.Rather, mine came with a simple flap to hold the 3DS XL as well as a thin zippered back compartment which unzips all the way (except for the bottom) to reveal slots for extra 3/DS games.But that's not why I bought this case.I needed a case for my Game Boy Color clone. Regular GBC cases didn't fit as the clone has slightly different dimensions. I prefer my clone over the standard GBC because of its excellent backlit screen (despite the aspect ration being *slightly* stretched).I realized cases for the DS XL and 3DS XL are the perfect size so I walked out the closest store that had such cases: Target.The case fits the clone (Kong Feng GB Boy Colour, if anyone was curious) perfectly, and, while I don't house cartridges in the back compartment, it can fit one or two snugly.The loop on top is very sturdy, and the color is a beautiful brilliant blue.

I don't own a DSi so I was hesitant about getting this, but the box indeed does stated that it works with the Lite. In fact, there are clips that adjust to accommodate either model.Out of the box it came adjusted to fit the DS Lite so I didn't have to mess with anything. There are instructions on how to adjust it, however, in case you need to.The stand is a durable plastic, but I was surprised to find how light it was. Before it arrived I had no idea how it stayed in place, considering it's a stand. I found that it accomplishes this by having EXTREMELY durable rubber feet, which do not slide at all once they're placed on a flat surface.The stand rotates by clicking in a swivel manner, as well as the stand itself rotating in degrees. There should be a comfortable angle for about anyone.It comes with a larger stylus as well for a more comfortable experience since your hand will be slightly elevated to accommodate the stand.Another excellent peripheral by Hori.

Bought this because Edward Scissorhands is my favorite film. I enjoy differently themed cards, but this is one of the lower quality themes.It's a standard plastic-coated paper deck with the same cover on all the cards. Nothing special. Get it if you love Edward Scissorhands, but don't expect the quality of the cards to last very long.

This review contains spoilers, but I'll preface such spoilers with an alert.The last trade paperback left much to be desired. The Walking Dead has been going on many years now, and it was inevitable that at some point it would start to go stale, at least in some point in the narrative. This last story arc was its low point. I even told someone after I read the paperback that it would be a good idea to end the series soon.But with this paperback I was wrong.***SPOILERS ABOUND!***This collection begins about two years after the events of the last trade. The colonies are now at peace--at least, until Kirkman allows them.But for once we get to see humanity slightly thriving once again. Of course, there's always the lurking enemy in the background, but they don't pose a threat. At least not until you realize the zombies can learn. Or at least that's what I thought.By the time we get a taste of what's really going on, I was disappointed slightly that it wasn't what I thought. It was thrilling enough, however, and I haven't felt that intense about a Walking Dead trade in a while.***END SPOILERS***I'm excited once again for this series. It was growing stale like the zombies in the story, but this new chapter in the saga gave it some new flesh.

Got this for my father-in-law as he's a huge Sherlock fan. I've never read any of them, though I did read this book a bit before giving it to him!It's a great set of the novels in a set of three, but I have to caution those against the Annotated version by Klinger.I love annotations--when they are done well. These editions are for those who know everything about everything the Sherlock realm. I've read Klinger's Dracula annotations and a bit here, and I was put off by his style of annotating. His references and notes are exhaustive to the point that they consume the fiction itself, taking up more room than the meat of the prose.If you really, really like Sherlock and know a great detail of the world, then I'm sure this is a good read. But if you're just starting up then I cannot recommend these titles.

I have always believed if you wanted to buy a faucet that would last a lifetime then buy a Moen. It's been my experience over the years that Moen is a company that makes quality products. Not only are they built great but they look great.  So when a new Moen Premium Traditional Soap Dispenser (Model # S3945C) was available through the Vine program and it arrived in the mail I couldn't wait to install it. Upon opening the box I discovered that the plunger was broken off the dispenser and lying loose in the box, rendering the dispenser useless.  I have been buying Moen products for years and this is the first time that I have ever received a defective Moen product.I contacted Amazon and they indicated that they no longer have any in stock for review, so my order has been voided.It's a beautiful product, no doubt, and looks to be highly functional, except mine didn't arrive in operable condition.

The Wii is one of the most versatile machines in the past decade; if you have a Wii and a PS3, you're pretty much set until the current generation catches up to the former's beefy library.The white Wii especially is greater than its descendants. The initial Wiis can play GameCube games, they come with component video signal, and, depending on your production run and ability to soft mod, come with DVD-playback capabilities. Take that and the ability to download WiiWare and Virtual Console titles, as well as most people installing The Homebrew Channel, and you've got yourself a powerful gaming machine for excellent classic titles.So, of course, you're going to want to share the wealth.I've taken my Wii to many homes and events. Friends and family loved it when it first came out, and, while its spark has certainly died down some, it's still a hit whenever I bring it around, especially since I'm able to run older games on it.Before, I used to use a messenger bag and hope nothing happened around inside. But after a few trips I decided to browse for a dedicated carrying case. This specific case turned up many positive reviews, so I decided to keep an eye out for it.But, by the time I found out about it, it had been out of production and the prices seem to incline. I was patient and managed to score one brand new at a fair price.After a couple of uses with this bag, I now look for ways to bring the Wii anywhere!Everything has a designated compartment, and even if you happen to forget what goes where there are labels above each compartment with a picture of what's supposed to go in. Everything fits wonderfully, but I will admit that the spaces for the console and receiver are a bit too snug than I'd like. Not sure if it's a good thing that it's so snug, but I haven't had any issues other than taking them in and out.The slot for games that hold a few discs with their cases packed tight, but I don't bring the cases anyway, so I can fit more games if I needed to by using temporary slim DVD cases or a CD wallet.The strap isn't removable, but that doesn't bother. Still, thought I should mention that.It's a great way to transport the Wii, but be careful if you're carrying this in public for long periods of time. As it screams "Wii" right on the bag, it may be a target for potential theft.My sister was visiting the other day and wanted to borrow the Wii, so after I got it all set in the bag I decided to move everything into a different, non-labeled bag since the word "Wii" is stitched on.Still, it's the best bag dedicated solely for Nintendo's Revolution, even though it's the only dedicated bag I've used!

I liked this preserver so much I now buy it as a gift for friends. Great for keeping that expensive bottle of wine fresh for as long as possible. This version is far sturdier than the plastic ones I used to find.

Continuing where the bounty hunters had left off (which I thought we'd never see more of again), Saga departs from the main storyline to add more "meanwhile" moments. Each page is fantastic and we finally get to see a confrontation I had been hoping since the introduction of the character who dons the cover. Can't wait for the next issue.

Many were upset about this, considering it's a bit more than the cost of half a guide, but I didn't mind much since the two guides combined come to about the MSRP of one guide in a brick-and-mortar store, not to mention that you'll get more content between the two than if they made one guide.But the previous Platinum guide didn't help, since that was both Diamond and Pearl guides in one, just on cheaper paper to save on costs.This guide has the majority of the walkthrough and the Gold/Silver Pokedex. The paper is very high quality, and the guide is very clean and organized. I wish more guides for handheld RPGs were like this.

The reason I ended up getting one is that it came bundled with Mario Kart Wii. For a while that was the only way to obtain the game new, anyway, so why not get an additional wheel?What I've found is that the wheel is great for those interested in the motion gimmicks and having a more casual experience. I use the term "casual" gently as I know how much of a dichotomy that word can create. Still, it's important to point out that a majority of competitive players will prefer using other controls, especially the GameCube or Classic Controller (and Pro).I'm not saying that the Wii Remote by itself (or with the Wheel) doesn't have pretty accurate controls; on the contrary, it has very good controls for being fully motion-driven. But extending your hands out can wear the muscles quickly. And controllers just have far more precise controls.It's fun, and it came with Mario Kart Wii, so I'm not complaining. My kid sister loves to use it, as well as a handful of my friends. In the end I ended up buying additional Wii Wheels, notably the black and golden versions.

My mom always had Shark vacuums and she loved them. I was excited to try this vacuum out. If you're looking for a lightweight vacuum to use in an apartment or smaller house, this would be a great option. I really liked all of the attachments and that it's a vacuum and handheld in one. The lights on the vacuum are especially helpful when vacuuming my poorly lit hallway. It's great on hardwood floors, rugs, and carpet. It comes with a hook to put on the wall for easy storage. This is also because the vacuum is top heavy due to the handheld being at the top. When moving furniture while vacuuming, I needed to place it on the floor as it couldn't stand on it's own and just fell over. This is inconvenient for me as I'm constantly moving furniture. This is, however, the only negative I found with this vacuum. Overall, great vacuum. I would say it's comparable to my Dyson.

I LOVE these pans!! I use them for just about anything and they are so easy to clean. These pans are $99 which may seem expensive, but they are well worth it. These have surpassed my expectations. The heat goes evenly through the entire pan. I have a feeling that I'll have these for a very long time.

Just got back from London and this pillow was a godsend for the long flight. It conveniently fits in the small pockets of your luggage and takes up very little space. I highly recommend this as a gift for the traveler in your life.

I feel like I could just cut and past the review for Black Ice Heart here.  Both had an element that was a big turn off for me.  In Frost Station Alpha a group of genetically engineered super humans kill almost everyone on the space station and then demand help making their planet livable.  Really!!  Who would think killing everyone would bring the help you need to survive?  Not me.Then one of the men doing the killing becomes the alpha hero.  This is not my choice for a hero.  He did change as the story progressed and it did not seem to bother others who reviewed the book.  I guess we all react to characters in our own way.Ruby Lionsdrake writes a very well plotted story and Frost Station Alpha is no exception.  The world building is very well done.  The characters are developed.  The story moves at a nice pace.  It was a story I expected to really like but I just could not get past the first action of the main male character.

There are many things to like about Black Ice Heart.  The world building is very well done.  The back story is told when and where needed.  The plot is interesting and moves at a nice pace.  The characters are well developed and interesting.  Everything is in place for a very good Science Fiction Romance story.  I should have loved it.  Instead there was an element that I did not like and as a result I could not enjoy it as much as I should have.That element was how the story started.  It started with the deaths of many of the occupants of the space station that serves as a prison.  It was not the deaths but who did the killing that bothered me.  I want consequences for actions and instead the killers ended up being portrayed as the good guys who were not responsible for their actions..The Scoriah start as killers and end up looking like long lost puppies.  It just did not work for me.  Joan Holly should have been running away from them screaming.  Instead she was cuddling with them.  While the Scoriah got away with murder their creator get the punishment she deserved.Something similar turned me off of Frost Station Alpha and my review is very similar.I like danger and tension.  I also like the bad guys who run around killing people to stay the bad guys.  When that does not happen it is a complete turn off for me.  I would like to see what others say about the story and if any had the same reaction as I did.I have enjoyed other stories written by Ella Drake so it was surprise when I reacted to this on as I did.

Using this cleans up all of those messy wires from when I used a power strip.  It fits into the outlet and then you plug your TV or other things in.  It is the weakest surg protected but fine for most things.  Well worth the money.
