I guess it was too much of an academic work for me.  It felt like a history class.

I'm giving this four stars because while I find the product completely unnecessary, my wife likes it. She would give it five. I wouldn't even have ordered it for free.Full disclosure- I was offered this product in exchange for my honest and frank review.  If you've read my reviews, you know I pull no punches.  I don't take things I wouldn't use. This product just didn't appeal to me and I was going to pass on it, but when my wife saw it, she got excited. So I got it to see what it's like.  It works as advertised.  It's a shelf attached to a pillow so that when you have your tablet and your legs are propped on the couch or you're in bed, you can read hands free.  It's fairly large- 18 inches across. For some reason, she got excited about the prospect of taking it on vacation. That's a lot of room in a bag when you're flying.  It's not something I would take.The construction is decent. I think the price is a bit high for what it is. And, be aware, if you have a case on your tablet, you will (most likely) have to remove the case to use this.

I am a Beach Body fan. I've done Insanity, P90X, T25 Alpha and Beta and been doing them for five years. T25 Gamma is the most challenging I can think of since Insanity.  It's also a big step up from T25 Beta. I can pretty much get through Alpha and Beta with no breaks, but Gamma is no joke.  There is a focus on strength- particularly upper body. Some of the workouts are a bit easier than others. Speed 3.0 takes Speed 1.0 and Speed 2.0 and puts them on steroids.  The burpees... oh the burpees. Every type imaginable.  Burpees with push up jacks.  Burpees with pike ups. Burpees with spider lunges, you name it...I just completed week 4 of Gamma and will not do the hybrid which mixes in some of Beta. Then, I think I'm going to give my body a break.  Gamma really hits the chest and shoulders hard almost every day. There are times when I'm doing it one day and can still feel the workout from the previous day.  But, I like the results!

I don't know why there are so many versions of this product on Amazon. I received these free of charge from the manufacturer and I'm pretty sure these are the ones I have, even though my box says Bluedio as the manufacturer, not Bestfire. They are S2 V4.0 Bluetooth and they look just like the picture.I have now at least six pairs of Bluetooth headsets. The sound quality on all of them is just mediocre. My understanding is Bluetooth compresses the sound and none of them are high quality sets- all selling for less than $50, most less than $30. One of my pet peeves with Bluetooth is on most of them the controls are on one of the ear pieces making it nearly impossible to operate them while you're on the move. These solve that problem by putting the controls on the strap between the ear pieces. It still sits uncomfortably high compared to the controls on a normal wire paid of earbuds, but it's better than most Bluetooth.The earbuds are unlike any others I've ever seen. More similar to Apple than to most. I don't see a big advantage, but one downside is the silicone pieces I have with my of my earbuds are interchangeable. If I lose or break one, I can grab or buy another one easily. These are a proprietary shape so you can only use their silicone pieces.Overall, these are pretty good, for the price. Not great, but maybe a notch better than others because of the placement of the controls.The manufacturer provided the item in this review to me for my frank and honest review. The opinions expressed here are solely my own. I receive no compensation for my reviews. And, like you, I rely on good reviews on Amazon so that I don‚Äôt buy products that waste my money.Pairing was easy. You can answer calls with them.

I have received no less than half a dozen Bluetooth headsets/earbuds for review.  I've been less than impressed with them.  And, frankly they are all practically interchangeable. I keep picturing a factory in China cranking them out by the dozens and just putting different manufacturers' names on them. These, however are different and worthy of some sort of design award.You'll notice when you look at these a unique configuration. There is a band that goes around your neck and the earbuds are attached to cords that reach up to your ears. The result is amazingly little downward force on the earbuds which causes all other earbuds to eventually pull themselves out of your ears, unless they are attached very well like some of the $150 corded pairs I have.But, the real benefit to the neckband is the placement of the controls.  On most headsets that are corded, the controls are on the cord dangling a few inches below your chin.  Easy-ish to get to. On the other Bluetooth sets I have the controls are on one of the earbuds making them nearly impossible to control while they are in your ear, even if you can remember how the controls. That has been of my major pet peeves with the Bluetooth sets I have. This one puts a large Play/Pause button on the part of the neckband that ends up resting on your collarbone. There is a small fast forward and rewind button on that same side.  On the other side is a button that with a single quick push launches Siri (on my iPhone), answers a call or, with a long push, calls back the last person you spoke with.  This is ingenious.  I can actually control my music with these without having to take them out of my ears or get my phone out of my pocket.The manufacturer provided the item in this review to me for my frank and honest review.  The opinions expressed here are solely my own. I receive no compensation for my reviews.  And, like you, I rely on good reviews on Amazon so that I don‚Äôt buy products that waste my money.

I actually just bought the smaller version of this monitor for my father after my brother recommended it. They both really like theirs.  I received this one through the Amazon Vine program so I decided to replace the 22" monitor that came with my HP computer.  The monitor is bright, sharp and flicker free. It looks nice on the desk.  It was a breeze to install.One advantage over the HP is the built in speakers. So, I could take the speakers off of the desk and just use the speakers in the monitor.  Every inch of desk space is precious.Overall, I am happy with it.

I have reviewed several Bluetooth headsets. This one falls right into the middle of the pack. I just imagine a factory in China cranking these things out and putting different manufacturers names on what are exactly or almost exactly the same headsets.Having said that, there is nothing wrong with these, if you want Bluetooth earbuds.  My problem with the category is general is it is solving a problem that isn't really a problem for me and introducing two more at the same time.  With all of the Bluetooth earbuds I own (I'm up to four pairs I think), I always reach for my ones with the cords.  The reasons are:1.) The Bluetooth ones have to be charged. While they stay charged for a quite a while. It's just another thing I have to remember to plug in.2.) The Bluetooth ones are more difficult to control.  Rather than having buttons on the wire dangling down near my chest area, there are fewer buttons (making control actually more complicated) and they are located in the ear bud, which if of course impossible to see when it's in your ear.The advantage of Bluetooth earbuds is no cord leading to your phone, but they, of course, have a cord between the two of them.  I sometimes have a small problem with the cord leading to my phone (especially if it's not long enough- I'm 6'2"), but it's a minor problem.  The problems introduced by being cordless outweigh that problem for me.  Even my daughters (who are constantly coming to me for earbuds), won't use the Bluetooth ones.Having given that caveat, I would say as Bluetooth earbuds go, these are good one.  The price seems to be in line with the others I have and they are practically indistinguishable. So, why not?The manufacturer provided the item in this review to me for my frank and honest review.  The opinions expressed here are solely my own. I receive no compensation for my reviews.  And, like you, I rely on good reviews on Amazon so that I don‚Äôt buy products that waste my money.

I have reviewed more earbuds than I can remember, including several pairs of Bluetooth earbuds.  These are the first headphones I have been provided to review and I have to say I am quite impressed.Like their earbud competitors, they paired easily with my iPhone. But, a huge advantage is access to the controls. All of the Bluetooth earbuds have the controls, such as they are, on the small piece that fits into your ear. Most of them have only a single button and a volume rocker. So, to do anything you have to remember how the button works.  I find it's actually easier to just pull out my phone and do what I need to do from there. With the additional real estate on the ear cups, the manufacturer has been able to give you controls that are actually usable.The headphones are really comfortable and the quality is higher than you would expect for the price. I would easily see paying 2-3 times or more for these if they had a certain logo on them.The manufacturer provided the item in this review to me for my frank and honest review.  The opinions expressed here are solely my own. I receive no compensation for my reviews.  And, like you, I rely on good reviews on Amazon so that I don‚Äôt buy products that waste my money.

I'm not an expert on Nutella, but that is the product people are going to compare this to.  I had my daughters taste it also. They are Nutella experts.  My understanding is this is less sweet and more deep in chocolate flavor than Nutella, both good things for me. It has an excellent, deep rich chocolate flavor.  My daughter who loves sweet things likes Nutella better.  My daughter who loves dark chocolate likes this better.  My only suggestion would be to add more hazelnuts.  I'd say it's chocolate flavor with a hint of hazelnut.I have a little concern with this is the all natural claim. It's sweetened with erythritol, a naturally occurring sugar alcohol. A sugar alcohol is a sugar molecule that has been fermented. While erythritol does occur in small quantities in some fruits, for commercial use it's generally obtained by a fermentation process.  The fermentation process allows the molecule to retain its sweet taste on your tongue, but your body doesn't not absorb it. Therefore it's extremely low in calories (in the US considered to be zero calories) and doesn't spike your blood sugar levels.  Erythritol, is less likely to cause stomach upset than some other similar sweeteners because it is absorbed through the intestinal tract and eliminated in your urine. The ones that pass through the digestive tract can cause discomfort and erythritol can to- in some people, if ingested in large quantities.Anyway, enough of the science lesson, but if you're eating this because it's Paleo and vegan and all that stuff, I thought you might want to know.  I wouldn't eat it in large quantities anyway, but it's a great sweet snack.  I'd buy the jars rather than the 100 calorie packs.  Why have all of that packaging and struggle to get the last bit of deliciousness out of these little packages?  Just don't eat massive quantities if you get the jar.The manufacturer provided the item in this review to me for my frank and honest review.  The opinions expressed here are solely my own. I receive no compensation for my reviews.  And, like you, I rely on good reviews on Amazon so that I don‚Äôt buy products that waste my money.

I have a coated cast iron Dutch oven which I love. So when I got the chance to test this I jumped on it.  If you don't have one of these, you should get one now. They are great for roasting meats in the oven. The heat capacity makes them fantastic for searing also. The semi-non stick surface will last many, many times longer than Teflon-type nonstick surface. The only way this thing won't last forever is if you chip the coating, which isn't really all that easy to do.I haven't heard of this brand, but I would say it's comparable to the one we all know.  My other dish is a Kirkland (Costco brand).  If you'd looked at the name brand version before you know these are insanely expensive.The finish is beautiful with a ruby red fading into black near the edges. Construction is exceptional.  I'd say at the price Amazon has it now it's probably a fair price, especially considering you'll probably have this the rest of your life.

The packaging is awesome. The jerky is very tasty. The chipotle cracked pepper one actually has a little kick to it, unlike other chipotle products I've had which tend to be way too mild. The jerky is moist and delicious. My only complaints are the bags themselves are very small.  This stuff is premium priced. And, there is way too much sugar in it. 12 grams of protein per serving and 6 grams of sugar.  Not only is that too much sugar in terms of health, the jerky is actually kind of sweet.  Now I should say I only like a touch of sweet even in my desserts and snacks. This is way too sweet for me to eat on a regular basis.  A little sugar to balance out the spice is fine. I just found it to be too much.

Many so-called lavender scented products just don't smell like high quality lavender. This candle is the exception.  I love the scent of lavender and there are many grades of lavender one can use in ones products.The fact that you can use the melted wax as a massage oil and/or a skin moisturizer is an added bonus. The all natural ingredients list is also a plus.  The price, for this quality, is very reasonable. The opinions expressed here are solely my own. I receive no compensation for my reviews.  And, like you, I rely on good reviews on Amazon so that I don‚Äôt buy products that waste my money.

Everyone is making a USB to Lightning Cable these days. There is no reason to buy Apple's overpriced cables anymore. Even if you do believe that Apple's cables are higher quality, you can get two (or more) of the competitors' cables for the same price. Even if they only last half as long, they're a better value. With so many choices which should you buy?I look for two things. You want to look for Apple MFi certified. Otherwise, you might end up getting error messages from your devices because Apple has made these cables so they need Apple licensed technology to be 100% compatible. Another thing to take into consideration is many cables restrict the side of the end of the adapter that can fit through the charging port. Cables that protect your phone often extend beyond the normal port. And, for some unknown reason, many manufacturers make the plastic piece around the lightning end bigger than Apple makes theirs (Apple's is minimal). Some are so big you have to remove your cover to get the end of the cable into your charging port.This cable, I am happy to report fits through the hole on one of my phone cases that another cable (Amazon Basics) won't fit through. I like that. It is slightly bigger than Apple's adapter, but not too big for that one case anyway. The build seems to be as sturdy as Apple's cable and the price is right. So, I would recommend this cable with no reservations.The manufacturer provided the item in this review to me for my frank and honest review. The opinions expressed here are solely my own. I receive no compensation for my reviews. And, like you, I rely on good reviews on Amazon so that I don‚Äôt buy products that waste my money.

When it comes to supplements how do you really tell what you are getting? It comes down to finding a source you trust.  Anytime someone says "I took this and it gave me so much more energy" (especially compared to another brand) I wonder if it's just the placebo effect.The product I received in exchange for my review seems to be high quality L-Carnitine.  I have taken it for a few days and I feel just fine.  I compared the price to my normal source of supplements and while the price is far less than some are selling l-carnitine for, it is more expensive than my normal source which is very inexpensive and my benchmark for pricing.
